title: Catering Consultant
description:
The Catering Consultant is responsible for supporting the Director of Sales with the day-to-day tasks including guest interaction, document preparation, catering lead inquiries and any other necessary tasks.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Managing client requests in an accurate and timely manner while ensuring the appropriate documents and correspondence is completed.
  • Maintaining a positive and friendly relationship with Hotel clients and guests and ensuring all questions, concerns or problems are handled accordingly.
  • Ensuring all catering events is entered into the appropriate booking system and creating Banquet Event Orders (BEO’s) or contracts and sending to the event contact for approval.
  • General administrative responsibilities including collecting payments or deposits if required, filing, calendar updates, answering the telephone, site tours and other duties as assigned.

Desired Qualifications:

  • Minimum High School Diploma, diploma or degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in Business Administration or Hospitality/Tourism is preferred.
  • Three (3) years-experience in an administrative catering or banquet role or similar.
  • Experience using Sales Systems, Microsoft Office including Outlook, Excel and Word with the ability to easily learn new software programs.
  • Ability to communicate clearly in both written and verbal form with strong attention to detail, grammar and spelling.
  • Excellent interpersonal, customer service and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize multiple requests or orders.

Terms of Employment:

  • This is a full-time position that is required Monday through Friday, 8:30am – 5pm with occasional evening and weekend availability.
  • This is a salaried position that will depend on experience and qualifications,
  • Must be able to pass a basic security clearance.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • administrative catering or banquet role or similar: 3 years (preferred)

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Job Summary

Reporting to the Managing Directors, the Executive Assistant for the Vancouver office is responsible for all essential administration, facilities and operational support for their assigned regional branches.

Key responsibilities include: ensuring 100% phone and reception coverage; making an outstanding first impression of S.i. Systems when consultants, prospective employees and other individuals visit the branch office; scheduling meetings; arranging travel; procurement of office supplies and other administrative duties. Special projects are also required on a regular basis, such as imparting training for new office equipment, office moves, consultant & team event planning, contest administration, and monthly reporting.

This position is in person Mon-Thurs and remote on Fridays.

Job Responsibilities

  • Answer phone and direct calls with efficiency and professionalism
  • Ensure all interviewees/appointments are greeted professionally and offered a beverage
  • Set up requested Appointments and Meetings
  • Meeting requests to include location, phone numbers, flight times, hotel as required for all trips
  • Receive and distribute branch mail
  • Responsible for branches filing and record maintenance
  • Order, receive and distribute stationery for Branches
  • Order, and receive office supplies
  • Order Promotional material for Branches
  • Prepare and distribute meeting materials, including minutes
  • Prepare and distribute Contest materials
  • Maintain a list of key external contacts for office: photocopier, coffee machine, property management office, etc.
  • Create expense reports for levels of Leadership and above only
  • Ensure reception, interview rooms, lunch and staff lounge spaces, and boardrooms are neat and clean at all times
  • Ensuring kitchen is clean and fully stocked with required inventory (perishable and otherwise)
  • Manage all inbound and outbound couriers
  • Organize Consultant/Client Events and Team Events which include, but not limited to, catering, reservations, ordering client/personnel gifts as required as well as arranging appropriate transportation for those in attendance.
  • Forward new candidate profiles to recruiters as they are received via the general mailbox and/or voicemail
  • Maintain required contact, follow up and administration for the branch phone number
  • Responsible for new hire transition which includes ordering of business cards, phone set up and stationary
  • Responsible for assisting MDs during an employee offboarding as needed
  • Responsible for liaising and being the point of contact with all vendors, suppliers and property managers and to be the subject matter expert on all BEA and office procedures
  • Manage, update and actively participate in their assigned S.I. Systems social media platform
  • Co-chair the health and safety committee for their regions
  • Other special projects as assigned
  • Responsible for branches filing and record maintenance

Experience & Education

  • Minimum 2 years of Administrative experience in a fast paced, dynamic organization
  • Exceptional knowledge of MS Office computer skills (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
  • Post Secondary Degree/Diploma in Business Administration or equivalent work experience

Personal Attributes

  • Optimistic, self-organized, keen attention to detail
  • Displays a Can-do attitude
  • Maintains professional and diplomatic interactions with all staff members and external contacts. Includes professional spoken, and written (grammatically correct) language skills.
  • Must have superior organizational, multi-tasking, communication, interpersonal, and administrative skills.
  • Able to multi-task and prioritize easily
  • Ability to perform tasks independently after training
  • Ability to prioritize
  • Ability to efficiently manage multiple tasks at the same time and ensure on time and successful delivery of all assigned projects

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $50,000.00-$55,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Executive & Personal Assistants: 2 years (preferred)

title: On Premise Manager (Musketeer) – Toronto West
description:
The Musketeer or On Premise Manager is responsible for growing Red Bull presence and sales across all segments of the On Premise business including Nightlife, Full/Limited service Restaurants, QSR, and Catering. The successful candidate will work with multiple distribution partners and field sales teams to drive consumption and horizontal growth of the brand. Additionally, they will be tasked with creating strong relationships amongst account owners and staff while executing all aspects of Red Bull’s On Premise business plan. Success will be assisted through working with multiple departments internal and external, developing lasting relationships with key partners, possessing strong negotiation skills, and fostering a solution-oriented mindset. The Musketeer must also possess the ability to deliver marketing programs to the accounts that will offset cash contributions and excite the consumer through unique Red Bull programming.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Areas that play to your strengths

All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:

Expand all

  • "LIVE" THE RED BULL ON PREMISE CULTURE: "CREATE AFFINITY"

    • Be a Red Bull Brand Ambassador
    • Bring the brand to life, from the trendiest restaurants and bars, the best clubs in town, and the biggest festivals, to the most private and exclusive events
    • Establish and nurture relationships with influencers and partners spreading affinity and enthusiasm for Red Bull
    • Build your personal reputation within the local scene based on your knowledge of the industry and latest trends
    • Your work lifestyle coincides with the Red Bull culture

  • TERRITORY MANAGEMENT

    • Complete ownership of the territory with the goal to maximize Red Bull consumption
    • Increases product availability and horizontal distribution in our current buying account base, through opening new account opportunities
    • Maps and evaluates all sales opportunities within defined territory
    • Builds and executes an annual territory business plan
    • Develops marketing and sales plans for all directly managed accounts
    • Accurately categorizes all opportunities as per the RBC guidelines
    • Sells in programs and strategies to drive Red Bull demand and consumption in outlet
    • Executes Red Bull High 5 Excellence and Perfect Outlet standards throughout territory, and tracking results
    • Responsible for direct territorial budgets, constantly evaluating to improve ROI
    • Activates Marketing and Trial initiatives in outlet to intensify consumption
    • Ensures transfer of knowledge to key On Premise stakeholders through training sessions
    • Monitors distribution of all Red Bull products and ensures that there are no out of stocks, through communication and training of the distributor reps in the territory
    • 80% of the time is spent in field, calling on accounts (Adjustments made for COVID-19 working conditions)

  • CITY ENTREPRENEUR

    • Take full responsibility for the on-premise sales and marketing activities in your market
    • Know your market like the back of your hand, keep an eye on the latest trends and maintain a look-out for new opportunities.
    • Establish ingenious strategies and creative tools to present the perfect pitch for Red Bull.

  • LEAD THE RED BULL EXPERIENCE

    • Perfect serve: ensure cold Red Bull Cans are given to consumers when ordered as a stand-along or as part of a mixed drink
    • Ensure visibility: ensure visibility is staged perfectly to increase sale
    • Complete Menu Entry: Ensure Red Bull products are listed on menus and displayed in accounts to optimize sales
    • Consumption Activation: sell by using appropriate consumption activation tools and marketing content resources
    • Staff Activation: Win the hears and minds of the service industry through staff activations, education and engagement

  • INDISPENSABLE BUSINESS CONSULTANT

    • As a trusted partner, strengthen and nurture our long-term relationships with established customers, and create new alliances with influencers and industry experts
    • Make every appointment with your customers the highlight of their day. They look forward to benefitting from your insightful thoughts, astute observations, and strategic considerations.
    • Negotiate mutually beneficial partnership agreements to build long-term relationships
    • Ensures professional conduct during all business interactions
    • Conducts business reviews with accounts and plans upcoming goals and initiatives
    • Ensures all account interactions have a specific business purpose

  • ASSET MANAGEMENT

    • Ensures that all POS items are tracked, staged and displayed appropriately (clean and in proper working condition)
    • Plans territorial POS forecast, to achieve business objectives
    • Fills, rotates and faces all Red Bull in coolers during every visit to maximize sales
EXPERIENCE

Your areas of knowledge and expertise

that matter most for this role:

  • Established contacts within the industry, or the ability to make them quickly and smoothly
  • Experience effectively selling to a customer base is a must, experience in the beverage industry, gastronomy, hospitality and nightlife a plus
  • You will work flexible hours, evenings, weekends, and some holidays, and excel with autonomy
  • You will work flexible hours, evenings, weekends, and some holidays, and excel with autonomy
  • Passionate about the on premise channel
  • Possess strong work ethic and business acumen
  • Creative, solution-oriented mindset. “DO IT NOW” attitude
  • Self-motivated and able to work independently
  • Fully understands and embraces the musketeer profile
  • Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
  • A valid driver’s license and clear drivers abstract
  • Post Secondary Education – Sales and Marketing preferred
  • Fluent in English, additional language skills an advantage
  • Travel 50%
  • Permanent

company: Nunavik Regional Board of Health and Social...
description:
Under the authority of the Acting Director of Regional Human Resources Development, the technician will support his immediate superior as well as the staff of his department in administrative tasks.
More specifically, the technician will:
Ø Assist fellow on-boarding training managers by coordinating the registration process for participants, securing reservations for training rooms and catering services, reporting on attendance to the Human Resources department of the two health centers, assuming responsibility for receiving invoices and expense account forms from consultants and following up with the accounting department, ordering and ensuring an inventory of training materials, compiling statistics and ensuring support for logistical aspects;
Ø Support logistics activities related to recruitment activities;
Ø Keep an inventory of promotional material and ensure the coordination, in collaboration with the NRBHSS communication department, of the production of promotional material;
Ø Assume responsibility for the logistical aspects of certain working committees sending and controlling invitations, managing the logistics of participant travel, writing the agenda and the minutes of meetings, ensuring room reservations and videoconferencing equipment and ensuring support for other logistical aspects;
Ø Produce presentation documents such as Power point, organization charts, Excel tables to meet the needs of its management;
Ø Support the director and the professionals of his direction in the logistical aspects of their travels, as well as their projects, meetings and committees;
Ø Perform any other related task at the request of his immediate superior.

Qualifications

College diploma in office automation or other relevant discipline. However, a combination of relevant experience and training may be considered;

Relevant professional experience;

Excellent speaking and writing skills in at least two of the three languages used in Nunavik (English, Inuktitut, French);

Good skills for teamwork and priority management;

Very good knowledge of the Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).

Candidates who are beneficiaries of the James Bay and Northern Québec Agreement shall receive priority.

Conditions and benefits
  • Permanent, full-time position (35 hours/week)

  • Position based in Kuujjuaq or in telework with travel to Nunavik

  • Salary according to the rules issued by the MSSS and the experience acquired (24.21$/h to 32.32$)
Additional details

Interested candidates should send their résumé, no later than May 6th, 2022, at 5:00 p.m., care of:

Human Resources

Nunavik Regional Board of Health and Social Services

P.O. Box 900, Kuujjuaq, Québec J0M 1C0

title: newDesign and Construction Coordinator
description:
Our Corporate Design and Construction team is hiring a Design and Construction Coordinator based in Toronto Corporate Office. This role will report to the Senior Vice President, Architectural Design and Construction (D&C) and will provide administrative support and assistance with key department initiatives.
This position requires a highly motivated and positive individual who is a productive self-starter, capable of working with little supervision. The duties and responsibilities span a wide range of activities requiring a candidate who is flexible, co-operative, organized and able to handle multiple tasks. This is a full-time position.
Key roles and responsibilities:
Project Coordination, Initiatives and Special Projects (60%)
  • Manage incoming and outgoing drawings, standards; administer and archive within shared information library
  • Assist in consolidating review comments, coordinate internal feedback from all stakeholders; prepare summary notes and issue to relevant stakeholders
  • Provide support on project reports and schedules, create and maintain property and project files
  • Work directly with the SVP, D&C on special projects
  • Support internal D&C initiatives (i.e., ESG, DIB, etc)
  • Assisting SVP, D&C with project specific tasks in initial project stages or as required
  • Create professional PowerPoint presentations including speaking notes for internal and external stakeholders.
General Administrative Tasks (40%)
  • Responsible for handling proprietary and sensitive business information - from information about property acquisitions, to highly sensitive personnel matters for the company
  • Proactively manage daily calendar, demonstrating flexibility and problem-solving abilities to adjust or prioritize schedules based on last-minute changes
  • Manage incoming and outgoing correspondence including telephone, email, mail, and couriers. Identifying urgent and risk items, re-directing queries appropriately, and responding without supervision to routine matters
  • Manage preparation and distribution of inventory of all collateral, magazines, direct mail, etc.
  • Liaise with key internal and external stakeholders to facilitate confidential company meetings and projects
  • Arrange department meetings, presentations, social events, and celebrations
  • Draft announcements, letters, memos and email responses as required
  • Prepare and distribute information and materials in advance of meetings, conference calls, trips, etc.
  • Set up for meetings, room reservations, catering etc.
  • Organize media interviews and conferences in collaboration with the Corporate Communications Team
  • Ensure office equipment is working and office supplies are in stock
  • Assistance with other projects and personnel as required
  • Type, photocopy, and distribute correspondence, reports etc., including composition of letters for routine matters
  • Ensure latest and updated information sharing between Toronto and Regional offices
  • Take part in team calls, provide meeting records
  • Arrange all travel requirements, including detailed itineraries, airline reservations, ticketing, meeting information, contact information, maps, visas, etc.
  • Track annual travel calendar and manage expense reports
  • Allocate, submit, and track invoices (consultant, cell phone, conference calls, etc.).
Other prerequisites:
  • Degree or Diploma in any discipline
  • Hospitality experience is preferred
  • Good design and visual communication skills
  • Industry relevant education in architecture, design or engineering is strongly preferred
  • Minimum 5 years administrative/coordinator work experience in architectural, engineering, design, or construction industry required
  • Minimum 3 years knowledge of firsthand project development and business development.
This role will be a Hybrid working model, which will require 2-3 days per week in the Four Seasons Corporate Office located at 1165 Leslie Street, Toronto, Ontario #LI-Hybrid
  • The applicants must have eligibility to work in Canada.
  • All internal applications must be approved by May 4, 2022.
Four Seasons is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
For over 75 years, Medavie Blue Cross has been a leading health and wellness partner for individuals, employers and governments across Canada. As a not-for-profit organization, we proudly invest in communities to help address some of Canada’s most pressing health care challenges. We are one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures, one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Canada’s Life & Health Insurer of the Year for 2021 and an Imagine Canada Caring Company.

Our 2,400 professionals work across six provinces, united by our shared values of being caring, accountable, responsible, innovative and community-minded. We’re committed to ensuring our employees thrive in our award-winning, collaborative culture focused on ensuring health, wellness, and personal and professional growth through a variety of programs and support across our organization.

Together with Medavie Health Services, we are part of Medavie — a national health solutions partner with over 7,200 employees. Our mission is to improve the wellbeing of Canadians.

Job Title:
Administrative Assistant

Department:
Nova Scotia Prescription Monitoring Program

Competition:
84464

Internal/External:
Internal/ External

Employment Type:
Full-Time, Permanent

Location:
Dartmouth, NS AND Remote/Hybrid

Salary:
Competitive Compensation

Reports To:
Manager

Closing Date:
May 10, 2022



Position Summary
The Nova Scotia Prescription Monitoring Program (“NSPMP”) is a provincial program administered by Medavie Blue Cross on behalf of our client. The program’s mandate is to ‘Promote the appropriate use, and reduce the abuse and misuse of monitored drugs in Nova Scotia’. As the first point of contact for the program, you will play an important role in managing the multiple and complex relationships between the program, prescribers, pharmacies, and other stakeholders.

This position is responsible for handling confidential and sensitive information including personal health information. This role requires a high level of customer service, professionalism and communication skills (verbal and written). Strong personal ethics, critical thinking and independent troubleshooting skills required.

This position reports to the Manager, NSPMP, yet provides daily operational support to all PMP team members. This position is a great fit for someone with a pharmacy or medical administration background or strong administrative/computer skills with an interest in making a difference in the health and lives of Nova Scotians.
This role is 37.5 hours per week and requires the Administrative Assistant to be 2 days per week in the office, and the flexibility to work remote from home 3 days per week.
Work schedule is Monday to Friday with working hours of 8:30am-5pm.

Key Responsibilities
  • Be the main point of contact for incoming inquires, responsible for managing the PMP email box and answering the PMP 1-800 phone line, fielding incoming inquiries from prescribers, pharmacies, patients and other stakeholders.
  • General administrative duties including mail, data entry, scanning, answering emails, redacting documents, document merging.
  • Reporting directly to the Manager, NSPMP, provides support to the Manager and team members and consultants (i.e. document preparation, power point support, follow up calls, running and revising excel reports).
  • Board, Committee and other meeting support activities including: coordination of meeting schedules, meeting invites, catering, agendas, production/collation of meeting minutes, meeting package preparation/mailout, invoice/expense processing etc.
  • Provide a high level of professional customer service support to pharmacies, physicians, prescribers, patients and any other external stakeholders, ensuring the positive brand and reputation of the PMP is always maintained.
  • Provide support to stakeholders with inquiries via oral and written communication and liaise when needed to ensure a high level of service excellence. Escalate issues as required.
  • Manage program registrations, and prescriber onboarding.
  • Contact potential out of province prescribers to register with the program, explain process, send forms, follow up and complete registration and onboarding.
  • Coordinate enrolment for post-graduate prescribers in partnership with provincial academic institutions.
  • Offer technical support to prescribers using the online portal (i.e. password resets).

Required Qualifications:
Education: Post-secondary degree (or combination of experience and diploma) with a focus in Pharmacy Technician, Medical Office Administration, Business Administration, Science or a related field.
Work Experience: 2-5 years of relevant work experience providing administrative support; previous employment in a hospital, pharmacy, or clinical setting where managing confidential information was required would be an asset; previous experience working in a telephone-based customer service environment.
Other Qualifications: Training as a pharmacy technician or pharmacy assistant would be considered an asset.
Computer Skills: Strong computer skills in Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel and PDF merging and redacting are required; ability to design forms and templates; strong keyboarding skills; ability to enter data/information with precision.
Language Skills: Bilingualism would be considered an asset but not required.

We offer a best-in-class comprehensive total rewards package. Benefits include:
  • Defined Contribution Pension Plan and optional RRSP
  • 100% company-paid premiums for health and dental benefits
  • Additional Personal Spending Account
  • Additional Health Spending Account
  • Annual Incentive/Bonus plan
  • Vacation Time, Sick days and Personal/Family days
  • Optional additional vacation purchase plan
  • Employee and Family Assistance plan with additional access to online doctors, virtual consultations
  • Access to a variety of company training, development and corporate wellness activities, earning Medavie title of one of ‘Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures’
  • Flexibility in physical work location. Work from home/hybrid options available

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Medavie Blue Cross strives to foster a culture where everyone is enabled to achieve their full potential — a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) where we live our values every day in the way we treat each other, our members and the communities we serve. Accessibility is a top priority.

For applicants with disabilities, we provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform Medavie Blue Cross Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation. All personal information is collected under the authority of the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.

We would like to thank all candidates for expressing interest. Please note only those selected for interviews will be contacted.


Job Segment: Medical, Secretary, Pharmacy, Equity, Administrative Assistant, Healthcare, Administrative, Finance

title: Photo and Video Sales Consultant - Toronto
description:
Vistek Ltd. is Canada’s leading independent specialty retailer of photo and video gear, with stores in Toronto, Mississauga, Ottawa, Edmonton and Calgary, plus a robust online presence. Equipment rental is also a big part of our business model. Our product catalogue is vast, highly diversified and state of the art, catering to the needs of the B2C and B2B in both enthusiast and professional markets. We are seeking a Full-time Video/Photo Sales Consultant for our Toronto Store team.


For over 40 years, we’ve served the creative community by curating not only the best products but also the best in technical sales talent. The people who work here are tech-savvy and solutions-oriented, and everyone shares a company-wide can-do attitude.For more information about Vistek, please visit www.Vistek.ca/careers/


PRINCIPAL FOCUS:

Under the direction of store management, a Photo/Video Sales Consultant is responsible for serving the needs of our customers, meeting sales targets and all gross profit driving metrics including but not limited to service plans, accessories and applicable services while providing a best in class customer service experience.


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide best in class service to customers
  • Advises customers on the best choices for their video and/or photographic needs
  • Focused on the end result: meeting sales targets with happy customers
    • Meet sales targets through sales and sales related activities
      • Follow up with quotes, orders and posted invoices
      • Keep sales environment stocked, clean and tidy
      • Focus on various Vistek sales programs to enhance sales
    • Actively seeks methods for building relationship with customers and growing the client database
      • Create optimal opportunities through:
        • Follow up on quotes
        • Follow up calls to previous customers
        • Have an ‘anything for the customer’ attitude
      • Focused on continuous learning to stay in touch with latest technology
        • Keep personally up to date on products through the company website, seminars, web, magazines, discussions with colleagues, membership in associations etc.
        • Keep environment organized, clean and tidy
      • Complete other duties, projects and tasks as assigned
      • Presents a professional image to match the Vistek brand
      • Provide support to other departments when needed

COMPETENCIES:

  • Excellent interpersonal skills to serve all types of people in a positive professional manner
  • Ability to provide technical advice and solutions selling
  • Ability to develop and maintain excellent client relationships through strong customer service skills
  • Sufficient assertiveness to be able to ask for the sale and close.
  • Detailed and accurate, while multi-tasking
  • Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Graduate of a recognized post-secondary photographic, video or related program, or relevant experience
  • Ability to remain organized with a strong attention to detail
  • Able to lift 30 lbs.
  • 1 or more years working in a professional photographic and/or video environment
  • Extensive product knowledge in Photo and/or Video equipment is a requirement to provide best in class service
    • Proven familiarity with professional camcorders from Panasonic, Sony, JVC and Canon
    • Knowledge of DSLRs for video, camcorders, pro audio, sliders, video lighting and drones
    • Great familiarity with popular video workflows- post production
    • Competence with digital editing software (Avid, Matrox, Pinnacle, Final Cut Pro, Vegas, Premier, etc.) and/or photographic editing software)
  • Previous sales background is an asset
  • Competent in Microsoft suite and Mac operating systems
  • Comfortable using computerized inventory or other ERP system
  • Previous retail experience considered a definite asset

Vistek proudly supports employment equity and diversity and encourages all qualified applicants to apply. All job applicants have the right to accommodation if required.

We thank all applicants for their interest in this opportunity, but please note that only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted


No agencies please.

title: Catering Manager
company: Cambridge Red Deer Hotel & Conference Centre
description:
A HOTEL WITH THE FREEDOM OF STYLE!

Located in the heart of Central Alberta, the CAMBRIDGE RED DEER HOTEL & CONFERENCE CENTRE is the ideal place to start your career in hospitality while providing excellent and personalized service to our guests while working within a positive team environment.

Under the direction of the Director or Sales and Marketing, the Catering Manager is responsible for the direction and the full operation of the Catering Consultant team. The Catering Manager is responsible for revenue maximization, negotiation services and detail oriented planning to ensure flawless execution of group functions. Attention to detail is a must in this position with the planning and coordinating of meals, guestroom blocks and all other areas required to ensure meetings and events occur smoothly.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Train, supervise and work with all catering staff, in order to solicit and book banquet and catering functions;
  • Ensure customer satisfaction and maximize hotel revenue and profitability;
  • Maintain achievement of revenue goals;
  • Determines the customer's needs, space availability, meeting details and food and beverage requirements;
  • Evaluate profitability, timeliness, and desirability of the business;
  • Negotiate pricing and aggressively and immediately close the sale;
  • Responsible for maximizing revenues as well as maximizing function space usage and profitability;
  • Must practice superior sales skills that result in building/maintaining of professional business relations;
  • The individual must have solid knowledge of Delphi or equivalent and the ability to understand booking guidelines, and rate parameters;
  • Responsible for communication and following through with hotel management and outside vendors to ensure the sale commitment is fulfilled;
  • Distribute written communications detailing the needs of the customer and sales commitment (group resumes, event orders, etc.);
  • Responsible for establishing customer relationships that will encourage repeat business;
  • Maintains up to date computer data files to ensure proper coordination of sales commitment as well as customer needs;
  • Analyze and identify booking trends and patterns to maximize revenue opportunities;
  • Attend and participate in daily stand-up meetings, and other meetings as requested;
  • Act as a liaison with competitors, industry associations, keeping abreast of competitor's services, facilities, and accounts to ensure the hotel remains in a competitive position;
  • Prepare contracts, rate proposals and property information databases;
  • Maintain account files including signed contracts with current direct-bill applications;
  • Work with accounts payable to ensure clients on direct billing are paying in a timely manner;
  • Serve as effective liaison between hotel and accounts regarding billing;
  • Anticipate guests' needs, respond promptly and acknowledge all guests;
  • Maintain positive guest relations at all times, participate in hotel and departmental functions for clients and employees;
  • Facilitate Daily EO meetings; Responsible for collecting and reviewing EO's;
  • Review space releases prior to sending to DOSM for final approval;
  • Establish one-on-ones with Catering team to coach and develop;
  • Develop annual catering sales budget with DOSM and Director of F&B as required;
  • Maintain Catering forecast sharing this information is with the hotel Catering and Leadership team;
  • Develop and direct yearly/quarterly marketing plan to meet and exceed budgeted catering sales goal;
  • Maintain prospecting of at least 25 calls/visits per week; networking and attending at least one civic/professional activity per month;
  • Return all inquiry phone calls/walk-ins, conduct tours/entertain potential clients, create menu presentations for potential clients;
  • Communicate to Banquet Manager/Chef, the needs of the clients;
  • Coordinate sales efforts between hotel sales department and catering/private dining sales to ensure proper utilization of function space to yield maximum revenues;
  • Be part of creation of appropriate sales collateral and tools for department;
  • Ensure that function set- up meets and/or exceeds customer expectations by working closely with each group’s meeting planners to determine their needs for meeting rooms, food & beverage, and audio-visual equipment requirements;
  • In coordination with the banquet department, ensure functions meet the customer’s expectations by following up before and during the function;
  • Maintain control of functions including complete details of bookings in the software program provided;
  • Responsible for the day to day negotiation of prices with clients for catering functions and meeting rooms, as well as guest rooms and all aspects pertaining to each client file;
  • Prepare contracts for incoming catering client’s and prepare proposals for potential clients;
  • Conduct post-function reviews with clients;
  • Solicits re-booking from meeting planners prior to customer’s departure;
  • Take the initiative to exceed guest’s expectations;
  • Participate in sales missions and activities; participate in customer appreciation functions;
  • Acquire full knowledge of the hotel, in-house facilities, and local information to respond to guest inquiries;
  • Host pre-event meetings, as required, to ensure clients are comfortable with their decisions;
  • Performs other duties and special projects as assigned;

Education, Knowledge and Skills Required:

  • University or college diploma or degree in Business Administration or Hotel Management preferred
  • Two or more years experience in Catering and Events department preferred
  • Proven leadership skills; able to train and mentor Catering Team;
  • Strong multi-tasking abilities; exceptional communication and organizational skills;
  • Detail orientated with strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Understands customers, builds organizational creditability;
  • Displays a positive attitude, maintains enthusiasm and celebrates successes with the team;
  • Meets deadlines that are decisive and achievement orientated;

Physical Requirements as per job description but will include more:

  • Ability to sit for extended periods of time;
  • Ability to work on a computer for extended period;
  • Repetitive work such as keyboarding, filing, answering phones, etc.;
  • Forward bending and squatting while performing filing duties;

Hours of Work:
The hours of work for this position are typically Monday to Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Additional hours or hours outside of these timelines may be required due to operational requirements. Any additional hours or overtime must be approved by the Director of Sales and Marketing prior to being worked.
Full Time hours: 40 hours per week
Job Types: Full Time, Permanent

The CAMBRIDGE RED DEER HOTEL & CONFERENCE CENTRE is an equal opportunity employer and believes diversity strengthens us as a workplace;

All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. The successful candidate will be subject to a criminal record check and/or other background checks. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found. We appreciate and consider all applications; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

title: newConference and Content Specialist
company: Association of Faculties of Medicine of Canada
description:
Job Title: Conference and Content Specialist

Work location: Remote within Canada

Department: Member Services

Reports To: Conference Manager

Job Summary:
Reporting to the Conference Manager and in collaboration with Conference Coordinator, the Conference and Content Specialist is responsible for the abstract review process used to determine abstracts that will be displayed as part of the annual International Congress on Academic Medicine (ICAM). This role will also be responsible for all social events and business meetings that take part in the International Congress on Academic Medicine (ICAM) and other AFMC events, as required. The Conference and Content Specialist is tasked with sourcing all consultants for these events and will work closely with the destination partner to develop the companion program.

Responsibilities:

Abstracts

  • Support Abstract Selection Committees and Chairs;
  • Participate in the development of the Call(s) for Abstracts;
  • Open abstract portal (editing, updating software, planning timelines) ;
  • Coordinate Abstract Review Portal;
  • Recruit and support reviewers;
  • Support Abstract Submitters
  • Monitor the reviewing process and ensure completion by set deadlines;
  • Apply groups, as directed by the Abstract Selection Committee Chairs;
  • Schedule Abstracts into the Abstract Portal;
  • Troubleshoot Abstract Portal Issues;
  • Recruit moderators for Oral and Poster Sessions;
  • Support the development of Oral and Poster evaluations and provide for every session;
  • Coordination of moderators in real-time;
  • Compiles evaluations results by the end of the conference;
  • Publishing o Submit abstracts to be published o Monitor abstracts for updates o Support the process for publishing abstracts

Social Events Planning

  • Plan and coordinate the following events: o Learner Networking Reception o Learner-focused Social Event o Welcome Reception o Social Event o Career Fair Reception (with Sponsorship Coordinator) o International Reception o AFMC Awards Event and Reception
  • Support University Receptions
  • Other events as required

Business Meetings

  • Support external meeting planners
  • Book catering/AV
  • Plan internal onsite/virtual meetings

Companion Program

  • Plan daily out-trips for delegate families
  • Coordinate with local facilities and venues
  • Prepare marketing and communication messaging

Destination Partnerships

  • Plan and coordinate with host city to advertise local flair
  • Source and secure all consultants to support social aspects of the events (i.e., photographer, fitness instructors, entertainment, childcare, etc.),

Awards

  • Support the planning of the AFMC awards, closing ceremonies, and learner awards, in collaboration with the Director, Member Services

Financial Reconciliation

  • Reconcile billings for all flow-through expenditures for external meetings undertaken during the conference
  • Prepare contracts for approval by Conference manager
  • Invoice and pay all external parties and vendors

Direct Reports:

  • None

Desired Qualifications and Experience:

  • 3-4 years proven experience in special event or conference management within an academic environment including large-scale event planning;
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in delivering professional development within academic medicine or for health professions;
  • Completion of a college certification program related to events or experience equivalent (i.e.: event management, meetings and conference management etc.);
  • Exemplary verbal and written skills;
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills;
  • High degree of competency using meeting and events software (e.g., conference platforms or apps, registration systems, etc.);
  • Knowledge and comfort using emerging technologies and social media (tech savvy);
  • Strong sense of tact, diplomacy, maturity and professionalism;
  • Flexible and capable of multi-tasking with competing requests and priorities;
  • Ability to work effectively in a team setting and build collaborative cross-functional relationships;
  • Attention to detail and ability to learn quickly;
  • Highly motivated, positive attitude and the ability to work independently;
  • Ability to resolve routine questions and problems and know when to refer more complex issues to manager; and
  • Willing to travel occasionally, work flexible hours or overtime to meet conference deadlines.

Language Skills:

  • Bilingual, written and oral, in English and in French (Preferred)
  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret the complex documents.
  • Ability to respond effectively to the most sensitive inquiries or complaints in both languages.

Physical Demands:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to:

  • Sit, stand and occasionally required to walk or move around a remote office environment;
  • May be asked to lift and move up to 20lbs.

Work Environment:
The work environment described is a representation of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this role. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions

Application Process:
The AFMC is committed to the principles of equity, diversity, inclusion and belongingness in our operations and throughout our work environments and seek to employ individuals who share a commitment to promote and practice these principles. We believe in and promote the rights of all persons with disabilities as outlined in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA 2005) and its related Accessibility Standards Regulations. To meet this responsibility, the AFMC will make appropriate accommodations available. As required, please inform Human Resources of the nature of any accommodation(s) at any point throughout the recruitment process to ensure your equal participation

Applications will be accepted until May 20, 2022. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Sommaire du poste :

Relevant du/de la gestionnaire de conférence et en collaboration avec le coordonnateur/la coordonnatrice de conférence, le/la spécialiste de conférence et du contenu est responsable du processus d'examen des résumés utilisé pour déterminer les résumés qui seront présentés dans le cadre du Congrès international de médecine universitaire (CIMU) qui se tiendra tous les ans. Le/la titulaire du poste sera également responsable de toutes les activités sociales et réunions d'affaires qui se déroulent dans le cadre du Congrès international de médecine universitaire (CIMU) et d'autres événements de l'AFMC le cas échéant. Le/La spécialiste de conférence et du contenu est chargé(e) de trouver tous les consultants pour ces événements et travaillera en étroite collaboration avec les partenaires sur les lieux pour élaborer le programme complémentaire.

Responsabilités :
Résumés

  • Prêter main forte aux comités de sélection des résumés et aux présidents de ces comités.
  • Participer à l'élaboration du ou des appels à résumés.
  • Ouvrir le portail des résumés (édition, mise à jour du logiciel, planification des délais).
  • Coordonner le portail d'examen des résumés.
  • Recruter et prêter main forte aux réviseurs.
  • Appuyer les personnes qui présentent des résumés.
  • Surveiller le processus d'examen et veiller à ce qu'il soit achevé dans les délais impartis.
  • Mettre en place des groupes, selon les directives des présidents des comités de sélection des résumés.
  • Programmer les résumés dans le portail des résumés.
  • Trouver des solutions aux problèmes du portail des résumés.
  • Recruter des animateurs pour les présentations orales et les présentations par affiches.
  • Aider avec l'élaboration des évaluations des présentations orales et des présentations par affiches et veiller à les fournir pour chaque séance.
  • Assurer la coordination des modérateurs en temps réel.
  • Compiler les résultats des évaluations avant la fin de la conférence.
  • Publication o Soumettre les résumés à publier o Assurer le suivi des résumés en cas de mise à jour o Collaborer au processus de publication des résumés

Planification des événements sociaux

  • Planifier et coordonner les événements suivants : o Réception de réseautage des apprenants o Événement social axé sur les apprenants o Réception de bienvenue o Événement social o Réception du salon de l’emploi (en présence du coordonnateur/de la coordonnatrice des commandites) o Réception internationale o Réception et remise des prix de l’AFMC
  • Fournir de l’aide pour les réceptions des universités
  • S’occuper de tous autres événements au besoin

Réunion d’affaires

  • Assister les organisateurs de réunions externes
  • Réserver les services de restauration/d’audiovisuel
  • Planifier des réunions internes sur les lieux/en virtuel

Programme complémentaire

  • Planifier des visites quotidiennes pour les familles des délégués
  • Assurer la coordination avec les installations et les établissements locaux
  • Préparer les messages de marketing et les communications

Partenariats sur les lieux

  • Planifier et coordonner avec la ville d’accueil pour faire connaître les particularités locales
  • Chercher et trouver tous les consultants pour les aspects sociaux des événements (c.-à-d., photographe, moniteurs sportifs, divertissement, garde d’enfants, etc.)

Prix

  • Contribuer à la planification des prix de l'AFMC, des cérémonies de clôture et des prix pour les apprenants, en collaboration avec le directeur/la directrice des Services aux membres.

Rapprochements financiers

  • Effectuer le rapprochement des factures pour toutes les dépenses liées aux réunions externes organisées pendant la conférence
  • Préparer les contrats pour approbation par le/la gestionnaire de conférence
  • Facturer et payer toutes les parties externes et les vendeurs

Subordonnés directs :

  • Aucun

Expérience et qualifications souhaitées :

  • De 3-4 ans d'expérience avérée dans la gestion d'événements spéciaux ou de conférences dans un environnement universitaire, y compris la planification d'événements à grande échelle.
  • Connaissances et expérience avérées en matière de perfectionnement professionnel dans le domaine de la médecine universitaire ou des professions de la santé.
  • Achèvement d'un programme de certification collégiale lié aux événements ou expérience

équivalente (c'est-à-dire : gestion d'événements, gestion de réunions et de conférences, etc.).

  • Compétences orales et écrites exemplaires.
  • Excellentes compétences en matière de gestion du temps et d'organisation.
  • Haut degré de compétence dans l'utilisation de logiciels de réunions et d'événements (par exemple, plateformes ou applications de conférence, systèmes d'inscription, etc.).
  • Connaissance et aisance dans l'utilisation des technologies émergentes et des médias sociaux

(connaissance des technologies).

  • Sens aigu du tact et de la diplomatie, maturité et professionnalisme.
  • Souplesse et capacité à mener de front plusieurs tâches avec des demandes et des priorités concurrentes.
  • Capacité à travailler efficacement en équipe et à établir des relations de collaboration interfonctionnelles.
  • Souci du détail et capacité d'apprendre rapidement.
  • Grande motivation, attitude positive et capacité à travailler de manière autonome.
  • Capacité à résoudre les questions et les problèmes courants et à savoir quand soumettre les questions plus complexes au/à la gestionnaire.
  • Volonté de voyager à l’occasion, de travailler selon un horaire flexible ou de faire des heures supplémentaires pour respecter les échéances des conférences.

Compétences linguistiques :

  • Bilinguisme (français-anglais), à l’écrit et à l’oral (préférence)
  • Capacité à lire, analyser et interpréter des documents complexes.
  • Capacité à répondre efficacement aux demandes de renseignements ou à des plaintes de nature délicate dans les deux langues officielles.

Exigences physiques :
Dans l’exercice des fonctions liées à ce poste, l’employé(e) :

  • est régulièrement appelé(e) à s’asseoir, se tenir debout et à l’occasion marcher ou se déplacer dans un milieu de travail à distance;
  • peut être appelé(e) à soulever et déplacer des charges pouvant peser jusqu’à 20 livres.

Milieu de travail :
Le milieu de travail décrit est représentatif de ceux qu’un(e) employé(e) rencontre lorsqu’il ou elle exerce les fonctions essentielles de ce poste. Des mesures d’adaptation raisonnables peuvent être prises pour permettre aux personnes handicapées d’exercer les fonctions essentielles du poste.

Processus de demande :
L'AFMC s'engage à respecter les principes d'équité, de diversité, d'inclusion et d'appartenance dans ses activités et dans l'ensemble de ses milieux de travail et cherche à employer des personnes qui partagent l'engagement de promouvoir et de mettre en pratique ces principes. Nous croyons aux droits de toutes les personnes handicapées et nous en faisons la promotion, comme le stipulent le Code des droits de la personne de l'Ontario, la Loi de 2005 sur l'accessibilité pour les personnes handicapées de l'Ontario (LAPHO) et les règlements connexes sur les normes d'accessibilité. Pour s'acquitter de cette responsabilité, l'AFMC mettra à disposition des aménagements appropriés. Au besoin, veuillez informer les Ressources humaines de la nature de toute mesure d'adaptation à tout moment du processus de recrutement afin d'assurer votre participation égale.

Nous accepterons les candidatures jusqu'au 20 mai 2022. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt. Toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes sélectionnées pour un examen plus approfondi.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: newLead Recruitment Consultant - Vancouver
description:
Salary: CAD 68k per year + + Commission + Bonus
Reference: RG999501576

Recruitment Consultant

$68k Basic + Commission + Bonus + Medical

Vancouver - Flexible Home & Office


We are CORE. We are the hospitality talent experts. We’re passionate about people and the hospitality and service sectors.

We’re a different kind of placement agency, putting relationships at the forefront of our processes and committed to accelerating ambitions for both our clients and candidates.

It’s a fast paced, fun, and non-corporate vibe at CORE. We’re dedicated to building a dynamic, engaging, and inclusive workplace. We value individuality and reward hard work.

We’re worldwide. With offices in key locations in Europe, North America, Africa and The Middle East, we find and place talent in these locations and the rest of the world.

Our team. You can benefit from being surrounded by industry experts who love what they do. Loyal and hugely knowledgeable consultants who truly are the CORE of our business.

Fancy joining us ?


What’s in it for you ?

  • Competitive basic salary
  • Attractive commission structure (really!) based on personal targets
  • Additional Group commission per month based on company targets
  • Additional days annual leave for each year of service (capped after 5 years)
  • Extra days annual leave for your birthday
  • Regular team building and occasional team holidays
  • Flexible working week, home working available

Here’s what we’d like from you !

  • To be career driven and the want to succeed in a rapidly expanding business
  • Have a serious passion for customer service and ideally a background in hospitality – quality agency experience and a good understanding of recruitment is preferred too
  • Be super approachable and friendly (just like us !)
  • You need to be a self-starter – able to manage your own time and your desk
  • Forward thinking and exceptionally organized
  • Be able to handle and manage a large existing database as well as high volume in coming inquiries and applications
  • Comfortable at leading established accounts, working with clients to support their needs
  • Ability to actively develop new business leads, negotiate contracts and develop recruitment solutions to match client needs
  • Previous proven experience in sales, business development, account management or a senior management role

Some more things to sweeten the deal

  • Your tech is sorted – we’ll provide you with everything you need to work remotely
  • Wellness treats – who doesn’t love those little surprise gifts ?
  • Office dog - depending on location, guaranteed to improve your day by 100%
  • Regular breakfasts and lunches in the office (and sometimes at home)


Community

It’s important to us that we have talent from different backgrounds and lived experiences at CORE. We are aspiring to be an organisation that is representative of the world we live in, and we invite diversity in the hope to provide a safe and comfortable space where our people can fully express themselves and contribute to our community.


Recruitment Consultant

Competitive Salary + Commission + Bonus

Worldwide opportunities


If you are keen to discuss the details further, please apply today or send your CV to Rose@Corecruitment.com

COREcruitment are THE experts in recruiting for Hospitality, Catering, Leisure, Retail, FM, Property and Construction sectors.

To view other great opportunities please check out our website www.corecruitment.com or call us on +44 207 790 2666 for a confidential chat about upcoming opportunities. Likewise, if you are looking to recruit then we would love to hear from you.

Follow COREcruitment on your favourite social networks - Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and Instagram

title: Associate, Recruiting
description:
Position Summary:
As a member of the Toronto Recruiting team, assist in the development, planning, and execution of all Toronto Associate Consultant, Consultant, BEL, ADvantage, and summer intern program recruiting efforts.

Responsibilities and duties:
Event planning and execution
  • Coordinate logistics for (and in some cases, attend), marketing and closing events at undergrad and MBA schools; manage event invites, student sign up, catering, scheduling and RSVPs (combination of virtual, in the office and outside of the office)
  • Assist in screening logistics, including resume reviews, scheduling students, and Bain interview logistics memos using Avature (Bain recruiting system), book travel and send confirmations
  • Manage the in-office/Zoom interview process: point-of-contact for all candidates and interviewers, schedule interview times, create interview memos, etc.
  • Assist in the planning and coordination of all aspects of weekends for our undergrad and MBA offerees including venue sourcing and coordination, communication with recruits, offeree gifts, nametags, lunch/dinner/hotel reservations, catering
  • Assist in the planning and execution of the BEL, ADvantage, and summer intern programs in Toronto including intern training, social events, presentations, and reviews
  • Support our Recruiting DEI efforts, including our diversity internship programs
Communication management
  • Communicate & correspond with recruits on a regular basis. Maintain incoming inquiries, applications, and generate appropriate responses in a timely manner
  • Manage internal communications with local and global Bain consulting and recruiting staff (ie. referrals, global recruiting programs, etc.)
  • Manage external marketing communications with school career services offices and on-campus clubs and organizations, including email campaigns, invitations, marketing materials and room bookings on campus when in person, alternately schedule and host events via Zoom
  • Provide clear, timely responses to consulting staff involved in recruiting (e.g., interviewer schedules, managing commitments, recruiting events, etc.)
  • Utilize Avature (Bain Recruiting System) to update global team members on recruit status and event details
Other support
  • Utilize Avature for data entry, event management and reporting in a timely and accurate manner
  • Update trackers, excel files and power point presentations regularly with meticulous attention to detail
  • Create and track new hire paperwork
  • Assist in events commitments process for recruiting event
  • Assist with recruit gifts and expense reimbursements
  • Attend team meetings
  • Perform other duties as requested or as responsibilities dictate
Qualifications:
  • Associate or Bachelor’s degree or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
  • Outstanding interpersonal, professional, written/verbal communication, project management, customer service and organizational skills
  • Ability to represent Bain to prospective candidates and school contacts
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and changing environment
  • Ability to meet deadlines, prioritize assignments and juggle multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Windows, Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and MS Teams preferred
  • Flexibility with hours; ability to work overtime and evenings as needed
Applicant must have received, or be willing to receive, the COVID-19 vaccine, and be fully vaccinated (established 2 weeks following final dose) by date of employment with Bain & Company to be considered for Canadian based jobs, subject to required accommodation process.

title: Fashion Consultant
description:
Anthonys Fashion is a locally owned and operated clothing boutique catering to fashion-conscious men and women of all ages. Our primary focus is to guide our clients through the world of contemporary fashion.

We are looking for enthusiastic, motivated individuals to join our team.

We are the right fit for you if you:

  • have an eye for fashion
  • have a keen attention to detail
  • are punctual, reliable and consistant
  • have great communication ability
  • take pride in providing exceptional customer service
  • enjoy a fast-paced workplace
  • are social media savvy
  • are outgoing and enjoy social interactions

We offer:

  • competitive wages
  • sales incentives
  • fantastic discounts
  • benefits plan coming soon

Experience/Training

  • Point of sale, client relationship management, and inventory control software knowledge
  • Word, excel, email experience
  • Sales experience 1 year
  • Social media proficiency
  • tailoring familiarity
  • great style

Don't worry if you are lacking in experience,* we will train you.* We are looking for people of all ages to join our team! If you have a passion for helping people find the perfect outfit, we are looking for you.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 20-38 per week

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • Store discount

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • sales: 1 year (preferred)
  • customer service: 1 year (preferred)

If you have a passion for helping people find the perfect outfit, we are looking for you.", 'Experience:', 'Word, excel, email experience']

title: newPrint & Imaging Sales Consultant
description:
Vistek Ltd. is Canada’s leading independent specialty retailer of print, imaging, photo and video gear, with stores in Toronto, Mississauga, Ottawa, Edmonton and Calgary, plus a robust online presence. Equipment rental is also a big part of our business model. Our product catalogue is vast, highly diversified and state of the art, catering to the needs of the B2C and B2B in both enthusiast and professional markets. We are seeking a Full-time Print & Imaging Sales Consultant for our Toronto Store team.


For over 40 years, we’ve served the creative community by curating not only the best products but also the best in technical sales talent. The people who work here are tech-savvy and solutions-oriented, and everyone shares a company-wide can-do attitude.For more information about Vistek, please visit www.Vistek.ca/careers/


PRINCIPAL FOCUS:

Under the direction of store management, a Print & Imaging Sales Consultant is responsible for serving the needs of our customers, meeting sales targets and all gross profit driving metrics including but not limited to service plans, accessories and applicable services while providing a best in class customer service experience.


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide best in class service to customers
  • Advises customers on the best choices for their imaging and print needs
  • Focused on the end result: meeting sales targets with happy customers
    • Meet sales targets through sales and sales related activities
      • Follow up with quotes, orders and posted invoices
      • Keep sales environment stocked, clean and tidy
      • Focus on various Vistek sales programs to enhance sales
    • Actively seeks methods for building relationship with customers and growing the client database
      • Create optimal opportunities through:
        • Follow up on quotes
        • Follow up calls to previous customers
        • Have an ‘anything for the customer’ attitude
      • Focused on continuous learning to stay in touch with latest technology
        • Keep personally up to date on products through the company website, seminars, web, magazines, discussions with colleagues, membership in associations etc.
        • Keep environment organized, clean and tidy
      • Complete other duties, projects and tasks as assigned
      • Presents a professional image to match the Vistek brand
      • Provide support to other departments when needed

COMPETENCIES:

  • Excellent interpersonal skills to serve all types of people in a positive professional manner
  • Ability to provide technical advice and solutions selling
  • Ability to develop and maintain excellent client relationships through strong customer service skills
  • Sufficient assertiveness to be able to ask for the sale and close.
  • Detailed and accurate, while multi-tasking
  • Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Graduate of a recognized post-secondary fine arts and/or photo editing related program, or relevant experience
  • Ability to remain organized with a strong attention to detail
  • 1 or more years working in a professional print & imaging environment
  • Extensive product knowledge in print & imaging equipment and products is a requirement to provide best in class service
    • Proven familiarity with professional Adobe software, (Photoshop and Lightroom),
    • Knowledge of editing tablets and colour management tools
    • Great familiarity with photo imaging paper types and finishes
  • General computer knowledge, installing drivers, setting up hardware i.e., hard drives is essential.
  • Previous sales background is an asset
  • Comfortable using computerized inventory or other ERP system
  • Previous retail experience considered a definite asset
  • Able to lift 30 lbs.

Vistek proudly supports employment equity and diversity and encourages all qualified applicants to apply. All job applicants have the right to accommodation if required.

We thank all applicants for their interest in this opportunity, but please note that only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted


No agencies please.
