title: newProject Assistant
company: Association of Faculties of Medicine of Canada
description:
Job Title: Project Assistant

Work Location: Remote within Canada; Head office located in Ottawa, ON

Department: Member Services – Opioids

Reports To: Project Manager

Job Summary:

AFMC continues to embark on a national-scale initiative to develop established competencies and an online curriculum of courses relevant and accessible across our 17 Canadian medical schools. The Project Assistant will play a vital role and work closely with the Project Manager to execute and deliver all project objectives.

Responsibilities:

  • Logistics and Event Management
  • Coordinate/schedule meetings and teleconferences for all project-related committees, working groups and activities;
  • Draft project materials such as agendas, slide decks, articles, and meeting minutes;
  • Coordinate and support meetings throughout the year, with guidance from the Project Manager, including: sending invitations; tracking responses; ensuring room set up and technology needs; assisting with travel arrangements; and working with AFMC meeting planners to book catering (food and beverage) and venue specifications;
  • Prepare and distribute meeting materials (packages, name badges) and facilitation supplies;
  • Prepare, process and track expense claims, invoices and reimbursements; and
  • Proof materials and activity reports as required.
  • Scheduling and Communication
  • Coordinate the scheduling of activities (liaise with representatives throughout the year);
  • Liaise with consultants regarding task completion and content development;
  • Handle routine inquiries pertaining to the project;
  • Update and maintain accurate contact information database; and
  • Communicate with external contacts as required.
  • Project Administration
  • Maintain files / filing system (hard copies and electronic) via Sharepoint;
  • Collect and organize project resources;
  • Create templates as required (tracking, forms) and manage information to populate the templates;
  • Assist in creating regular progress updates to stakeholders;
  • Set up/Manage WRIKE software data entry and deliverables in the project; reporting accordingly;
  • Liaise with the consultants to track their deliverables; and
  • Design and implement surveys and provide reports.
  • Finance
  • Reconcile the project account ensuring receivables and payables are provided to the finance department on time; and
  • Update the AFMC annual forecasts/actuals and any project related external budgets/expenditures on a regular basis.
  • Reporting
  • Track key activities (including Deliverables, KT and Dissemination, Risks) that will be utilized in project reporting;
  • Analyze technical solutions to support the project as required; and
  • Assist with other miscellaneous tasks as required to meet the needs of the project.
  • Academic Support
  • Draft poster, oral and workshop abstracts and prepare presentation materials;
  • Collaborate with the project team to develop proposals for funding.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Direct Reports:

  • None.

Desired Qualifications and Experience:

  • Minimum 2 years of experience in a project-based or administrative capacity;
  • Post-secondary education from an accredited institution (diploma or certificate);
  • Experience in the health education sector is desirable; and,
  • Valid PMP/CAPM certification or working towards certification – Asset.
  • Advanced knowledge of scheduling programs and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook);
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Sharepoint;
  • Knowledge of project management principles and concepts;
  • Experience with project management software;
  • Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills;
  • Forward thinking with the proven ability to take initiative, and recommend solutions to challenges
  • Highly motivated, positive attitude and the ability to work independently within a virtual team;
  • Strong sense of tact, diplomacy, maturity and professionalism;
  • Above average technical skills;
  • Experience in creating and managing webinars;
  • Experience in contributing to the creation of reports including financial and progress reporting to federal government;
  • Flexible and capable of multi-tasking with several competing requests;
  • Functions effectively in a team setting and builds collaborative cross-functional relationships;
  • Effective time management skills with the ability to work well under pressure and meet tight deadlines;
  • Attention to detail and ability to learn quickly;
  • Resolve routine questions and problems, and refers more complex issues to supervisor; and
  • Willing to travel occasionally, work flexible hours or overtime to meet project deadlines.

Language Skills:

  • Bilingual (English and French) oral, written and reading comprehension skills is an asset
  • Ability to read, analyze and interpret the complex documents; and,
  • Ability to respond effectively to the most sensitive inquiries or complaints.

Physical Demands:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to:

  • Sit, stand and occasionally required to walk or move around a remote office environment;
  • May be asked to lift and move up to 20lbs.

Work Environment:

The work environment described is a representation of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this role. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Application Process:

The AFMC is committed to the principles of equity, diversity, inclusion and belongingness in our operations and throughout our work environments and seek to employ individuals who share a commitment to promote and practice these principles. We believe in and promote the rights of all persons with disabilities as outlined in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA 2005) and its related Accessibility Standards Regulations. To meet this responsibility, the AFMC will make appropriate accommodations available. As required, please inform Human Resources of the nature of any accommodation(s) at any point throughout the recruitment process to ensure your equal participation

Applications will be accepted until May 20, 2022. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Sommaire du poste :

L'AFMC poursuit ses activités dans le cadre de la mise en œuvre d’une initiative d'envergure nationale visant à établir des compétences et développer un programme de cours en ligne pertinent et accessible dans nos 17 facultés de médecine canadiennes. L'adjoint(e) de projet s’acquittera d’un rôle vital et travaillera en étroite collaboration avec le/la gestionnaire de projet pour exécuter et réaliser tous les objectifs du projet.

Responsabilités :

  • Aspects logistiques et gestion d’activités
  • Coordonner et planifier des réunions et des téléconférences pour tous les comités, groupes de travail et activités liés au projet.
  • Rédiger l’ébauche de documents de projet tels que les ordres du jour, les diapositives, les articles et les procès-verbaux des réunions.
  • Coordonner les réunions et fournir un appui connexe tout au long de l'année, sous la direction du/de la gestionnaire de projet, y compris l'envoi d'invitations, le suivi des réponses, la mise en place des salles et les besoins technologiques, l'aide aux préparatifs de voyage et la collaboration avec les planificateurs de réunions de l'AFMC pour réserver les services de traiteur (aliments et boissons) et voir aux spécifications des lieux.
  • Préparer et distribuer le matériel de réunion (trousses, insignes nominatifs) et les fournitures d'animation.
  • Préparer, traiter et suivre les demandes de remboursement de dépenses, les factures et les remboursements.
  • Revoir le matériel et les rapports d’activité au besoin.
  • Établissement du calendrier et communication
  • Coordonner le calendrier des activités (assurer la liaison avec les représentants tout au long de l'année).
  • Assurer la liaison avec les consultants en ce qui concerne l'achèvement des tâches et l'élaboration du contenu.
  • Traiter les demandes de renseignements courantes concernant le projet.
  • Mettre à jour et tenir à jour une base de données exacte sur les coordonnées des personnes-ressources.
  • Communiquer avec les contacts externes au besoin.
  • Administration du projet
  • Tenir à jour les dossiers et le système de classement (copies papier et électroniques) par l’entremise de Sharepoint.
  • Recueillir et organiser les ressources du projet.
  • Créer des modèles au besoin (suivi, formulaires) et gérer l’information pour remplir les modèles.
  • Aider à créer des mises à jour régulières sur les progrès pour les intervenants.
  • Mettre en place/gérer la saisie de données dans le logiciel WRIKE et les produits livrables dans le cadre du projet; établir des rapports en conséquence.
  • Assurer la liaison avec les consultants afin de suivre leurs réalisations.
  • Concevoir et mettre en œuvre des sondages et fournir des rapports.
  • Finances
  • Procéder à une réconciliation au sein du compte du projet en s'assurant que les comptes recevables et les comptes payables sont fournis au Service des finances dans les délais impartis.
  • Mettre à jour régulièrement les prévisions/réalités annuelles de l'AFMC et tout budget/dépense externe lié au projet.
  • Rapports
  • Suivre les activités clés (y compris les produits livrables, le transfert et la diffusion de connaissances, les risques) qui seront utilisées dans les rapports de projet.
  • Analyser les solutions techniques pour soutenir le projet selon les besoins.
  • Aider à effectuer d'autres tâches diverses selon les besoins du projet.
  • Soutien universitaire
  • Rédiger les ébauches de résumés d'affiches, d'exposés oraux et d'ateliers et préparer les supports de présentation.
  • Collaborer avec l'équipe du projet pour élaborer des propositions de financement.
  • S’acquitter des autres tâches qui lui sont confiées.

Subordonnés directs :

  • Aucun.

Qualifications et expérience souhaitées :

  • Au minimum 2 ans d'expérience dans une fonction administrative ou de projet
  • Études postsecondaires dans un établissement accrédité (diplôme ou certificat)
  • Expérience souhaitée dans le secteur de l'éducation sanitaire
  • Certification PMP/CAPM valide ou en cours d’acquisition (un atout)
  • Connaissance avancée des programmes de planification et de Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint et Outlook)
  • Connaissance pratique de Microsoft Sharepoint
  • Connaissance des principes et concepts de la gestion de projets
  • Expérience relative au logiciel de gestion de projet
  • Excellentes aptitudes interpersonnelles et organisationnelles
  • Réflexion prospective et capacité avérée à faire preuve d'initiative et à recommander des solutions aux problèmes
  • Grande motivation, attitude positive et capacité à travailler de façon autonome au sein d’une équipe virtuelle
  • Sens aigu du tact et de la diplomatie, maturité et professionnalisme
  • Compétences techniques supérieures à la moyenne
  • Expérience dans la création et la gestion de webinaires
  • Expérience de la contribution à la création de rapports, y compris des rapports financiers et des rapports d'état au gouvernement fédéral
  • Souplesse et capacité d'exécution de plusieurs tâches à la fois avec plusieurs demandes concurrentes
  • Capacité à fonctionner efficacement au sein d'une équipe et à établir des relations de collaboration interfonctionnelles
  • Compétences efficaces en gestion du temps, capacité à bien travailler sous pression et à respecter des échéanciers serrés
  • Souci du détail et capacité d'apprentissage rapide
  • Aptitude à résoudre les questions et les problèmes courants et porter les questions plus complexes à l’attention du/de la superviseur(e)
  • Prêt(e) à voyager à l'occasion, à travailler selon un horaire flexible ou à faire des heures supplémentaires pour respecter les échéances du projet

Compétences linguistiques :

  • Bilinguisme (anglais et français) à l’oral et à l’écrit et capacités de compréhension en lecture (un atout)
  • Capacité à lire, analyser et interpréter des documents complexes
  • Capacité à répondre efficacement aux demandes de renseignements ou aux plaintes les plus délicates

Exigences physiques :

Dans l’exercice des fonctions liées à ce poste, l’employé(e) :

  • est régulièrement appelé(e) à s’asseoir, se tenir debout et à l’occasion marcher ou se déplacer dans un milieu de travail à distance;
  • peut être appelé(e) à soulever et déplacer des charges pouvant peser jusqu’à 20 livres.

Milieu de travail

Le milieu de travail décrit représente le genre de milieu au sein duquel évoluera l’employé(e) qui s’acquitte des fonctions essentielles de ce poste. Des aménagements raisonnables peuvent être consentis afin de permettre aux personnes ayant une limitation fonctionnelle d’accomplir les fonctions essentielles du poste.

Processus de candidature :

L'AFMC s'engage à respecter les principes d'équité, de diversité, d'inclusion et d'appartenance dans ses activités et dans l'ensemble de ses milieux de travail et cherche à employer des personnes qui partagent l'engagement de promouvoir et de mettre en pratique ces principes. Nous croyons aux droits de toutes les personnes handicapées et nous en faisons la promotion, comme le prévoient le Code des droits de la personne de l'Ontario, la Loi de 2005 sur l'accessibilité pour les personnes handicapées de l'Ontario (LAPHO) et les règlements connexes sur les normes d'accessibilité. Pour s'acquitter de cette responsabilité, l'AFMC mettra à disposition des aménagements appropriés. Au besoin, veuillez informer les Ressources humaines de la nature de toute mesure d'adaptation à tout moment du processus de recrutement afin d'assurer votre participation égale.

Les candidatures seront acceptées jusqu'au 20 mai 2022. Nous remercions tous les candidats et les candidates pour leur intérêt, mais seules les personnes sélectionnées seront contactées.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: newRecruitment Consultant - Vancouver
description:
Salary: CAD 50k per year + + Commission + Bonus
Reference: RG991393821VAN

Recruitment Consultant

$50k Basic + Commission + Bonus + Medical

Vancouver - Flexible Home & Office


We are CORE. We are the hospitality talent experts. We’re passionate about people and the hospitality and service sectors.

We’re a different kind of placement agency, putting relationships at the forefront of our processes and committed to accelerating ambitions for both our clients and candidates.

It’s a fast paced, fun, and non-corporate vibe at CORE. We’re dedicated to building a dynamic, engaging, and inclusive workplace. We value individuality and reward hard work.

We’re worldwide. With offices in key locations in Europe, North America, Africa and The Middle East, we find and place talent in these locations and the rest of the world.

Our team. You can benefit from being surrounded by industry experts who love what they do. Loyal and hugely knowledgeable consultants who truly are the CORE of our business.

Fancy joining us ?


What’s in it for you ?

  • Competitive basic salary
  • Attractive commission structure (really!) based on personal targets
  • Additional Group commission per month based on company targets
  • Additional days annual leave for each year of service (capped after 5 years)
  • Extra days annual leave for your birthday
  • Regular team building and occasional team holidays
  • Flexible working week, home working available

Here’s what we’d like from you !

  • To be career driven and the want to succeed in a rapidly expanding business
  • Have a serious passion for customer service and ideally a background in hospitality – quality agency experience and a good understanding of recruitment is preferred too
  • Be super approachable and friendly (just like us !)
  • You need to be a self-starter – able to manage your own time and your desk
  • Forward thinking and exceptionally organized
  • Be able to handle and manage a large existing database as well as high volume in coming inquiries and applications
  • Comfortable at leading established accounts, working with clients to support their needs
  • Ability to actively develop new business leads, negotiate contracts and develop recruitment solutions to match client needs
  • Previous proven experience in sales, business development, account management or a senior management role

Some more things to sweeten the deal

  • Your tech is sorted – we’ll provide you with everything you need to work remotely
  • Wellness treats – who doesn’t love those little surprise gifts ?
  • Office dog - depending on location, guaranteed to improve your day by 100%
  • Regular breakfasts and lunches in the office (and sometimes at home)


Community

It’s important to us that we have talent from different backgrounds and lived experiences at CORE. We are aspiring to be an organisation that is representative of the world we live in, and we invite diversity in the hope to provide a safe and comfortable space where our people can fully express themselves and contribute to our community.


Recruitment Consultant

Competitive Salary + Commission + Bonus

Worldwide opportunities


If you are keen to discuss the details further, please apply today or send your CV to Rose@Corecruitment.com

COREcruitment are THE experts in recruiting for Hospitality, Catering, Leisure, Retail, FM, Property and Construction sectors.

To view other great opportunities please check out our website www.corecruitment.com or call us on +44 207 790 2666 for a confidential chat about upcoming opportunities. Likewise, if you are looking to recruit then we would love to hear from you.

Follow COREcruitment on your favourite social networks - Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and Instagram

title: newDevelopment Manager
description:
Are you a high energy, results oriented professional with experience in Urban Planning and Development?

CityState Consulting Group is looking for a Development Manager to join its growing team in Port Moody, BC!

ABOUT YOU

You are an experienced Development Manager with a passion for the industry, a strong client centric approach and a desire to work on exciting projects in the Urban Planning and Design space. With your experience in Development (ideally a blend of public and private sector), you are ready for the opportunity to accelerate your personal and professional growth and create long-lasting relationships built on accountability, transparency, and quality. You are looking to join a company for long term career success, and a team that works hard and takes the time to celebrate accomplishments together along the way.

ABOUT CITYSTATE CONSULTING GROUP

We are a rapidly accelerating Urban Planning and Design firm located in a modern, spacious office in the heart of Port Moody’s heritage district, where our professional team draws inspiration from the clients we work with and our exceptionally talented colleagues. Supporting a variety of clients in the Lower Mainland, Sunshine Coast, and Okanagan we are a multi-faceted firm specializing in everything from OCP amendments, rezoning, subdivision and development applications, environmental enhancements to heritage revitalizations and providing sustainable building design services.

Whether it’s in the realm of policy research and development, design and concept plans, or process management, we attribute our success to close relations with municipalities, while providing a quick turnaround to support our clients by creating innovative solutions for (often) uniquely challenging sites.

We take great care in selecting clients and team members who will align closely with our values and do what’s right; to protect the environment, save heritage structures and develop in a way that enhances our surroundings; at CityState we build better communities. From our stunning designs and the fine art displayed on our walls to the work that we deliver, we take utmost pride in the details!

YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Development Manager reporting to the firm’s Senior Planner, your day-to-day duties will include:

Client Management & Relationship Building (25%)

  • Provide innovative and integrated consulting services to our private and public clients
  • Rapidly respond to client requests and encourage an overall sense of urgency.
  • Review, summarize and strategize responses to various municipalities, while building strong relationships with City staff
  • Demonstrate an ability to comprehend and provide recommendations to influence civil plans, architectural designs, topographical surveys, geotechnical reports, arborist reports, etc., in a way that serves in the clients best financial interest
  • Create and grow strong client relationships through timely and effective communication, trust and accountability
  • Present data and materials to clients in a succinct and simplified manner, catering to our clients’ business and financial needs

Project Management (60%)

  • Coordinate effectively with Engineers, Surveyors, Biologists and related professionals to achieve project goals and milestones
  • Liasing with City staff and acting as the main point of contact for updates and inquiries
  • Analyze applicable bylaws and policies related to planning and development projects
  • Prepare reports, analyses and studies related to community planning, policy, land use
  • Deliver development concepts and comprehensive neighbourhood planning projects
  • Lead innovative public consultation processes
  • Consolidate planning and development proposals, applications and plans compliant with relevant planning and development policies

Leadership (15%)

  • Supervise and provide direction to other team members when acting as Project Lead
  • Close communication and timely follow-up with all involved in designated projects to continuously drive them forward
  • Analysis and verification of sub-consultant reports to distinguish and advise on ‘good enough’ and ‘outstanding’ work

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS

  • Master’s Degree in Urban Planning, a related discipline, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • 5+ years of experience working in land development processes and community planning in BC or a similar environment
  • Experience in both Public and Private Sectors is considered an asset
  • Previous education in Business or Project Management considered an asset
  • Leadership experience in coordinating multidisciplinary teams
  • Ability to manage complex land development and community planning projects
  • Ability to conduct planning research, prepare reports, and lead public consultation programs
  • Exceptional writing, research and communication/public speaking skills
  • Excellent computer skills proficiency with Project Management software, Microsoft Suite, Acrobat Pro, SketchUp, Rivet and AutoCAD
  • Comprehensive understanding of land development processes, applicable government regulations and planning theory
  • Exceptional problem-solving skills, particularly at the design and construction stages
  • Ability to work efficiently and accurately under pressure and tight deadlines
  • Existing business relationships in the development industry
  • Willingness to work in-person in our state-of-the-art Port Moody, BC Office

OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU

We’re committed to our small and mighty team and take care of our people. In addition to joining an organization that values you, your contribution and your growth, some of the benefits you will receive include:

  • A team committed to putting people first and creating long-lasting relationships.
  • A beautiful office that is centrally located in Port Moody and easily accessible (only a 7-minute walk from the SkyTrain!)
  • Recognition programs to celebrate excellence and performance.
  • Shared commitment to excellence in every project that we touch.
  • Endless opportunities for personal and professional growth, including networking in our neighbouring co-working community

Plus, the basics:

  • Competitive compensation plan
  • Comprehensive health, medical and dental benefits plan that is flexible to meet your specific needs
  • Paid vacation
  • Full-time work & flexible working hours

If you are ready to contribute to an organization that has its sights set on the future, we want to meet you!

Please apply today by submitting your resume and cover letter.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Port Moody, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

title: Administrative Assistant - Wealth Solutions
description:
Posting Description:

Aon is seeking an Administrative Assistant

As part of a market-leading team, you will contribute to the creation of tangible results for our clients through the application of innovative and effective solutions within our Wealth Solutions Consulting group at Aon in Montreal, Quebec. As an Administrative Assistant, you will work directly under the direction of the Manager of Administrative Operations and provide support to a team of senior consultants.

Your impact as an administrative assistant

Professionalism

  • Demonstrates excellent customer service skills and exceptional attention to detail.
  • Superior writing skills: grammar, punctuation, spelling and proofreading.
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills.
  • Works independently with a variety of individuals and teams.
  • Demonstrates strong organizational and management skills.
  • Displays a professional appearance and demeanour in a casual work environment.
  • Demonstrates discretion in highly confidential matters.
  • Possesses a high degree of creativity and flexibility.
  • Suggests approaches to solving problems.
  • Maintains a high level of confidentiality.
  • Motivated teammate, able to work independently with minimal direction.
  • Able to interact effectively with clients and team members, demonstrating professionalism at all times.
  • Able to work in a fast-paced, demanding environment.
  • Self-prioritizes work and projects; achieves measurable progress by communicating effectively, openly and consistently with managers and team members

Responsibilities

  • Supports an executive level manager, which is a manager who is a member of the executive team.
  • Administrative activities include email management, time registration, full calendar management, research or other special projects.
  • Schedules and coordinates meetings, including room reservations and ordering/delivering food, if necessary.
  • Coordinates logistics for complex on-site or off-site meetings; this may include, but is not limited to, budgeting, travel, room reservations, meeting room logistics and equipment, and catering.
  • Interacts daily with internal and external senior managers and their administrative assistants.
  • Coordinates projects and works independently; seeks answers to questions, demonstrates initiative, uses network of resources to resolve issues.
  • Assists others in understanding or obtaining technology or facility support.
  • Provides back-up assistance to other administrative assistants as needed.
  • Able to compose documents from raw notes or independent knowledge of circumstances.
  • Maintains/updates/organizes categories and data in databases, OneNote or SharePoint.
  • Prepares and produces presentations, correspondence, and related documents, including checking for grammar, punctuation, and clarity.
  • Maintains a flexible approach and demeanour toward assisting others; models, coaches and mentors administrative assistants who aspire to advance to the Senior Administrative Assistant level.
  • Acquires and maintains knowledge of internal network and resources.
  • Possesses a thorough knowledge of the Aon brand identity.
  • Seeks additional responsibilities.
  • Acts as a key resource to the team (i.e. independently seeks answers to questions, demonstrates initiative, uses network of resources to resolve issues, and proactively passes on knowledge to peer network).
  • Strategic, solves problems and establishes procedures that result in process improvements.
  • Records hours accurately and submits them in accordance with company guidelines.
  • Self-prioritizes work and projects; achieves measurable progress by communicating openly with managers and team members in a consistent manner and with the highest quality.
  • Acts as a subject matter expert for internal tools and resources.
  • Other duties may be added based on business needs.
Experience and Requirements :
  • Minimum of three (3) years experience in a similar role;
  • Bilingual (English and French), both written and spoken;
  • Proficiency in MS Office software (Word, Excel and PowerPoint);
  • Punctuality and reliability;
  • Organizational skills, initiative, resourcefulness and attention to detail;
  • Flexibility and team spirit;
  • Demonstrated organizational skills;
  • Ability to work independently with a variety of people.

We offer you

A driven total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience:

From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.

About Aon:

Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.
By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.
Aon is committed to ensuring an accessible online application process for all candidates, including individuals with disabilities, by offering an alternative way to apply for job openings. The alternative application method is only available for those who cannot otherwise complete the online application due to a disability or other need for accommodation
Aon provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce.

Disclaimer:

Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time

title: newEducation Specialist (1-year contract)
description:
At McCarthy Tétrault, we offer challenging and rewarding career opportunities and are delighted to have been selected as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for the tenth consecutive year in 2022, as well as one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers. Our culture is built on professional excellence, collaboration, innovation, thought leadership and entrepreneurialism. We embrace inclusion in all its forms and we provide the tools and opportunities to help our people develop to their full potential.

This position can be based out of Montreal. McCarthy Tétrault employees benefit from a hybrid work environment.

McCarthy Tétrault’s Education team supports the ongoing development of legal knowledge, practice skills, client development abilities and leadership capacities for lawyers, students and paraprofessionals. These seminars, workshops, meetings, and e-learning modules are led by a faculty composed of our own lawyers as well as industry experts.

As an Education Specialist, you will be:

Education programs

  • Administering, co-ordinating and delivering national and regional lawyer education programs.
  • Meeting with partners and practice leaders to identify new areas/types of programs and to discuss current offerings.
  • Liaising with internal and external experts to identify new programs and speakers.
  • Arranging and leading meetings of speakers, assembling and distributing materials for review by speakers, introducing programs, etc.
  • Arranging all program/workshop logistics including catering, boardrooms, video conference equipment as well as all technology and documentation requirements, as required.
  • Sending program notices, invitations, reminders and confirmation information to participants and speakers.

Regulatory Compliance

  • Administering all aspects of the regional Mandatory Continuing Professional Development (MCPD) Regime in the assigned region, including submitting and tracking accreditation applications and tracking attendance for all related programs.
  • Keeping current a list of lawyers who have compliance obligations under multiple MCPD regimes and communicating regularly with those lawyers to identify programs available to them to meet their requirements.
  • Using and contributing to the ongoing development of all related protocols and tracking systems.
  • Acquiring and maintaining knowledge of the requirements of the regional MCPD Regime.

Department Administration & Co-ordination

  • Co-ordinating and collaborating with members of the Education Team in the application of project management principles to all aspects of the department’s work.
  • Responding promptly to requests and inquiries from internal and external clients – providing them needed direction, assistance, materials and resources.
  • Organizing department meetings including preparing agendas and minutes, as required.
  • Arranging for payment of consultant invoices, fees or charges for attendance at programs by lawyers.

As our ideal candidate, you will have:

  • Undergraduate university or college degree (Administration or HR preferred). Study related to adult learning an asset.
  • A minimum of 5 years of experience in a program development and implementation role with significant administrative responsibilities.
  • Experience interfacing with senior professionals and members of the business community.
  • Fluency in English and French, both spoken and written.
  • Significant flexibility in order to deliver various education programs including flexible lunch hours, arrival and departure times as well as some evening work during heavy workload periods.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and comfortable speaking to groups at programs or meetings.
  • Very collaborative and high level of service orientation with the ability to problem solve.
  • Self-starter who takes initiative with exceptional organizational and time management skills, and who works efficiently with minimum supervision.
  • Ability to maintain a fast pace and manage multiple demands under pressure by prioritizing.
  • Strong attention to accuracy and detail.
  • Experience in legal administration (asset).

As a member of the McCarthy team, you will have access to:

  • Outstanding benefits from day one, including insurance premiums paid by the Firm.
  • Competitive compensation including paid overtime.
  • A commitment to professional development and growth opportunities for our people at all levels, supported by a culture that fully embraces and encourages two-way feedback.
  • Strong community involvement and a commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.
  • A collaborative, cohesive culture that connects lawyers and business teams through collective purpose.

We thank all applicants for their interest in McCarthy Tétrault; however, only chosen applicants will be contacted. We regret that we are unable to respond to individual inquiries about application status. McCarthy Tétrault is an equal opportunity employer that fosters an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment. Please notify us if you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 12 months

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Coordinator, Office Services & Facilities
description:
Miller Thomson LLP is one of Canada’s fastest growing national business law firms, with offices located in Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton, Regina, Saskatoon, London, Kitchener-Waterloo, Guelph, Toronto, Markham, Vaughan and Montréal. Our consistent ability to provide practical, creative and cost-effective advice, combined with an unyielding service commitment to our clients and a strong dedication to our lawyers, staff and the communities in which we practice, gives us a unique position in the Canadian legal industry.
We are seeking a Coordinator, Office Services & Facilities to join our* Edmonton* office with the added opportunity for involvement in firm-wide projects.

The Coordinator, Office Services & Facilities is responsible for coordinating and supervising the day-to-day operations of the Office Services teams within the Firm's Edmonton office. The role reports ultimately to the Firm's Chief Administrative Officer (based in Vancouver), and requires working closely and collaboratively with the Edmonton Office Managing Partner to ensure that local office objectives and requirements, including service levels, are being met.

This is a hands-on position in a fast-paced and challenging environment that requires a confident self-starter with the desire to promote a client-first focused culture. The successful candidate will demonstrate initiative, a “can do” attitude with strong people management, communication and organizational skills. Being a contributing team player is essential along with work hours flexibility including on-call and after-hours work as required. Ensuring that the team provides a first class service to the office's lawyers and staff, you will also be part of the national Office Services team with the opportunity to contribute to a range of major firm-wide projects.

The local team includes the following functions: mail / courier delivery, copying / scanning / printing / binding services, office supplies and equipment, reception, host services (catering / boardrooms) and records management. This position is also responsible for local facilities management and works with the building landlords / management, trades people and other contractors and consultants to ensure the smooth operation of the office facilities and related services.
In this role, responsibilities will include (but will not be limited to):

  • Training and general supervision of all Office Services staff to promote a client-first focus and ensuring that expected service levels are met
  • Managing and coordinating the local purchase of all office supplies, furniture and equipment including through the Firm's national supply vendors as appropriate; making recommendations for improvement Liaising with local vendors and suppliers; sourcing new suppliers as required
  • Managing and coordinating general office and furniture maintenance (including both leased and owned equipment), repair of furniture, equipment servicing, and acting as the day to day liaison with building management
  • Acting as “boots on the ground” managing premises moves and renovations working closely with the Chief Administrative Officer and his team
  • Overseeing and managing moves (eg office moves, new joiners) along with new furniture installs; liaising with IT and Talent Services as required
  • Processing invoices for all supplies and equipment purchased and seeking approval when required from the Chief Administrative Officer or his team
  • Working as a part of the Firm's national Office Services team on firm-wide projects
  • Assisting the Chief Administrative Officer and his team in the preparation and maintenance of the annual Edmonton office budget and reporting monthly on expenses
  • Overseeing the Edmonton office business continuity plan, safety compliance and emergency evacuation program and related training
  • Managing security access card system; ensure documentation is current and accurate; liaise with building management security team
  • Coordinating Office Services staff schedules to ensure coverage
  • Personally handling overflow work as required within the department during staff absences and busy periods

To be successful in this role, you possess the following:
Education and Experience:

  • University bachelor's degree and / or community college diploma with min 3 years’ office management / facilities experience preferably gained in a law firm or professional services environment

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in dealing with all levels of the Firm
  • Holds self and others accountable for performance, takes ownership and champions the quality delivery of service
  • Strong customer service orientation
  • High levels of personal integrity, diplomacy and confidentiality
  • Self-sufficient and works well under pressure to manage and meet multiple deadlines, with a flexible attitude and professional approach
  • Ability to plan, organize and coordinate the work of others and to develop and implement processes and procedures to obtain maximum efficiency, prioritizing tasks in a fast-paced and time-sensitive environment.
  • Proactively identifying problem areas, devising solutions and communicating them to team members and internal clients
  • Aptitude for embracing new technology and change
  • Excellent MS Office skills

Please note that, Miller Thomson LLP and Miltom Management LP (the “Firm”) have a COVID 19 vaccination Policy that requires all Firm members and visitors to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada to access our premises. Unless otherwise mentioned in the job posting, Applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment from the Firm will be required to provide a proof regarding their vaccination status in line with our policy as a condition of employment. The Firm will consider individual requests for accommodation by applicants who cannot be fully vaccinated due to medical, religious, or other grounds to the extent protected by applicable human rights legislation.
Miller Thomson LLP is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.
While we thank all applicants for their interest, due to the high volume of applications we receive, we are unable to respond to queries individually and only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls or agencies please.
Miller Thomson will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, please inform our Talent department of the nature of accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Education Specialist (1-year contract)
description:
At McCarthy Tétrault, we offer challenging and rewarding career opportunities and are delighted to have been selected as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for the tenth consecutive year in 2022, as well as one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers. Our culture is built on professional excellence, collaboration, innovation, thought leadership and entrepreneurialism. We embrace inclusion in all its forms and we provide the tools and opportunities to help our people develop to their full potential.

This position can be based out of Montreal. McCarthy Tétrault employees benefit from a hybrid work environment.

McCarthy Tétrault’s Education team supports the ongoing development of legal knowledge, practice skills, client development abilities and leadership capacities for lawyers, students and paraprofessionals. These seminars, workshops, meetings, and e-learning modules are led by a faculty composed of our own lawyers as well as industry experts.

As an Education Specialist (1-year contract), you will be:

Education programs

  • Administering, co-ordinating and delivering national and regional lawyer education programs.
  • Meeting with partners and practice leaders to identify new areas/types of programs and to discuss current offerings.
  • Liaising with internal and external experts to identify new programs and speakers.
  • Arranging and leading meetings of speakers, assembling and distributing materials for review by speakers, introducing programs, etc.
  • Arranging all program/workshop logistics including catering, boardrooms, video conference equipment as well as all technology and documentation requirements, as required.
  • Sending program notices, invitations, reminders and confirmation information to participants and speakers.

Regulatory Compliance

  • Administering all aspects of the regional Mandatory Continuing Professional Development (MCPD) Regime in the assigned region, including submitting and tracking accreditation applications and tracking attendance for all related programs.
  • Keeping current a list of lawyers who have compliance obligations under multiple MCPD regimes and communicating regularly with those lawyers to identify programs available to them to meet their requirements.
  • Using and contributing to the ongoing development of all related protocols and tracking systems.
  • Acquiring and maintaining knowledge of the requirements of the regional MCPD Regime.

Department Administration & Co-ordination

  • Co-ordinating and collaborating with members of the Education Team in the application of project management principles to all aspects of the department’s work.
  • Responding promptly to requests and inquiries from internal and external clients – providing them needed direction, assistance, materials and resources.
  • Organizing department meetings including preparing agendas and minutes, as required.
  • Arranging for payment of consultant invoices, fees or charges for attendance at programs by lawyers.

As our ideal candidate, you will have:

  • Undergraduate university or college degree (Administration or HR preferred). Study related to adult learning an asset.
  • A minimum of 5 years of experience in a program development and implementation role with significant administrative responsibilities.
  • Experience interfacing with senior professionals and members of the business community.
  • Fluency in English and French, both spoken and written.
  • Significant flexibility in order to deliver various education programs including flexible lunch hours, arrival and departure times as well as some evening work during heavy workload periods.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and comfortable speaking to groups at programs or meetings.
  • Very collaborative and high level of service orientation with the ability to problem solve.
  • Self-starter who takes initiative with exceptional organizational and time management skills, and who works efficiently with minimum supervision.
  • Ability to maintain a fast pace and manage multiple demands under pressure by prioritizing.
  • Strong attention to accuracy and detail.
  • Experience in legal administration (asset).

As a member of the McCarthy team, you will have access to:

  • Outstanding benefits from day one, including insurance premiums paid by the Firm.
  • Competitive compensation including paid overtime.
  • A commitment to professional development and growth opportunities for our people at all levels, supported by a culture that fully embraces and encourages two-way feedback.
  • Strong community involvement and a commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.
  • A collaborative, cohesive culture that connects lawyers and business teams through collective purpose.

How to apply:

We invite you to submit your application to careers@mccarthy.ca. We thank all applicants for their interest in McCarthy Tétrault; however, only chosen applicants will be contacted. We regret that we are unable to respond to individual inquiries about application status. McCarthy Tétrault is an equal opportunity employer that fosters an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment. Please notify us if you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process.

title: ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT
description:
ID #
19902
City
Vancouver
Job Type
Permanent - Full Time

WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

VANCOUVER

We are a global leader in the Earth and Environment sector, made stronger with the recent acquisition of Golder. Globally headquartered in Montreal, where it all began, we proudly serve communities from coast to coast and beyond. With Golder now part of our WSP team, we have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.

As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources, expertise, and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from marine biologists to geophysicists to geotechnical engineers and more.


The Opportunity:

You’ll be part of our growing Business Operations Team, using your skills to support Project Managers and Consultants within the Earth and Environment Business.


Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging
  • Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.
  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP

A day in the life:

  • You'll use your expertise to format letters, technical memorandums, proposals, reports spreadsheets, and other documents
  • You’ll use Adobe Professional to create and compile PDF documents from MS Office applications
  • You’ll open opportunity, proposal, and project numbers using Oracle CX
  • You’ll help maintain inventory of PPE and field equipment
  • You’ll help with place catering orders and provide support for meetings
  • You’ll provide office-based assistance to Consultants and Senior Group Administrators

We'd love to hear from you if you have ...

  • 1-2 years of experience providing administrative support in a professional office environment
  • Proficient with Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint)
  • Excellent spelling, grammar, and proofreading skills
  • Key Attributes
    • team player with a flexible, can-do attitude
    • good problem-solving skills with the initiative and ability to identify alternative solutions
    • attention to detail and ownership of delegated tasks
  • Graduate of business administration diploma preferred
  • Knowledge of engineering consulting and/or related industries would be an asset.
  • You want to experience what it’s like to work for the leading environmental consulting firm globally and be part of a growing and thriving team!

Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.


Vancouver, BC

title: Site Manager - Bralorne Gold Mines
description:
Company Overview

Talisker Resources Ltd. is a resource company that is engaged in the exploration and
development of mineral properties in British Columbia. Our flagship property is the
Bralorne Gold Mine located 195 KM northwest of Vancouver near Lillooet and the Ladner
Mine. In addition has a large exploration team focused on properties comprising
291,339 hectares over 322 claims, six leases, and 181 crown grant claims in south-
western British Columbia. The Company is well funded to advance its aggressive
systematic exploration and development program at its projects.

Talisker Resources is led by one of the most experienced and successful exploration
and leadership teams and boards in the business. This team has been together since
the early 2000s and has a clear vision of what it takes to be successful in resource
exploration and development and has the experience and knowledge to execute that
vision.

Staff describe the company culture in terms of being a positive, collaborative
environment with these commonalities:

  • Consists of a really good team of people
  • Respectful, flexible, helpful environment
  • Friendly environment
  • Everyone has a common goal


Talisker is an equal opportunity employer committed to employment equity and foster a
work culture that supports personal and professional development and training. We
strive to hire locally and from our neighboring Indigenous communities. Please let us
know if you are from the area in your cover letter.

Please visit our website to review our commitment to Environmental Initiatives and
Indigenous Engagement:

Environmental Initiatives - Talisker Resources Ltd.

TSK-Indigenous-Engagement-Policy-Jan13-20.pdf (myftpupload.com)

2

Cultural Fit

  • Personality plus - kind, caring, respectful, team player
  • Someone who is curious and wants to learn
  • Not too serious but hard-working, positive, can-do attitude
  • Very accepting, open and honest, transparent
  • Persistent, patient, flexible, approachable, friendly
  • Professional demeanor – high standards and professional integrity


Position Summary

Talisker Resources is looking for a Site Manager to oversee the Operations team at
Bralorne Gold Mines. Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, the Site Manager will be
responsible for overseeing the daily operational activities and manage the coordination
of contractors to ensure work complies with site requirements, health & safety, and
ministry requirements.

The position is based in Bralorne, British Columbia. The successful candidate will work
on a rotational schedule. Relocation package is available to Lillooet and surrounding
area.

Key Duties and Responsibilities

  • Manages the human, financial, and operational resources at Bralorne Gold and
Ladner Mines;
  • Formulates the annual operating and capital budgets for operations, consistent with
Talisker’s established financial guidelines and business planning process;
  • Oversee the health and safety of site operations including underground activities;
  • Oversee the Camp Maintenance and manage the catering & Camp services at
Bralorne.
  • Oversees the implementation of processes, policies, systems, and practices within
operations that maximize operational efficiencies;
  • Lead and manage the operations team responsible for supporting the Geology
team in executing Talisker’s exploration strategy;
  • Develops policies and standard operating procedures relating to safety, the
environment and individual;
  • Ensures that direct reports and respective work areas are in compliance with Health
and Safety policies and Environmental regulations;
  • Ensures direct reports have the necessary training, skills, knowledge, and tools to

do their jobs safely;

3

  • Lead on accident and incident investigations and ensures that recommendations
are implemented;
  • Oversees management of the Water Treatment Plant; and
  • Other duties as required by the Chief Financial Officer.


Qualifications, Experience, Knowledge and Skill Requirements

  • The position is based in Bralorne, British Columbia on a workable rotation schedule
or relocation package is available
  • Related work experience in mining and mineral exploration industry considered an
asset
  • Requires in-depth knowledge of managing a remote exploration and mining camp
including site construction, maintenance and operations
  • Requires experience working with support consultants and an understanding of BC
Mines Act legislation and the Health, Safety and Reclamation Code for Mines in
British Columbia
  • Must be familiar with the social and political expectations of mining companies and
be able to work effectively with government officials, Indigenous people, community
leaders, and landowners
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office, Excel, Word and PowerPoint
  • Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals
  • Leadership skills with excellent team-building skills and ability to manage stress and
tight deadlines
  • Excellent time management, problem-solving and project management skills
  • Exceptional communication skills – written and verbal
  • Valid driver’s license
  • Working knowledge of British Columbian and Canadian environmental regulations,
guidelines, and standards is an asset.
  • Safety certificates or designations would be considered an asset
  • Mines Supervisor Certification or Shift Boss Certification an asset
  • Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.

4

Application Process

Please submit your resume and cover letter citing the title “Site Manager” in the subject
line to: bralornecareers@taliskerresources.com

title: newProject Coordinator
description:
Who is Bronte Construction?
Bronte Construction prides itself on our innovative approach and expert team. Together, we successfully implement quality construction projects, with an embedded environmental focus, that enhance communities for generations. Our team lives and breathes our Foundation Principles which consist of Safety, Balance, Culture, Quality, and Character. Our organization is composed of long-term team members, who are passionate about doing their best work every day, on every site.

How We’re Different

  • Annual Rankings for 2016, 2017, 2018, and 2019 as one of the fastest-growing companies in Canada
  • Awards for Environmental Project of the Year 2018
  • IHSA COR Certified
  • Great health, dental and vision insurance
  • RRSP plan that includes company dollar-for-dollar match on weekly contributions
  • Paid Vacation time off each year, in addition to statutory holidays
  • Participation in yearly training and career development programs
  • Project Performance Bonus Incentives
  • Weekly Catering of Breakfast and Lunch

The Role
Our Project Coordinators plan and coordinate administrative efforts of her/his assigned construction projects. Project Coordinators are deeply engaged from the start to finish of their assigned projects. Project Coordinators work under the guidance and mentorship of assigned Project Managers and can expect exposure to different types of onsite activities. Project Coordinators ensure construction complies with drawings and project specifications. Bronte Project Coordinator must understand how to effectively use Bronte workplace technology for scheduling/planning and cost controls.

Responsibilities

  • Assists with scheduling, costs, and safety
  • Organization of Material and Subcontractors
  • Assists with planning and execution efforts
  • Creation, organization, and submission of various documentation

A day in the life

  • Assist Project Managers and Site Supervision, in the day-to-day duties of a project’s administration.
  • Process contract documents in accordance with the drawings and specifications
  • Assist project team in planning/scheduling and specification analysis
  • Assist project team in researching and recommending solutions to design document problems, including conflicts, interferences, and errors/omissions.
  • Prepare and maintain accurate and up-to-date logs (RFI, Submittals, Shop Drawings, Vendor/Subcontractor Awards, Contact List, etc.)
  • Track responses and advise the Project Manager and Site Supervision of the status of RFIs.
  • Review shop drawings/submittals received from subcontractors and forward to owner/consultant for approval.
  • Process changes received from the Client and/or Consultant
  • Manage all required project documentation in both hardcopy and digital – as required
  • Assist with subcontracts documentation – as required
  • Track project progress and contract execution along with associated documentation to ensure seamless payment procedures.
  • Attend or champion project meetings, bi-weekly or as requested, or required.
  • Accountable for project notes from project meetings
  • Distribute meeting notes among all project stakeholders.
  • Organize, coordinate and communicate with all subcontractors
  • Effectively addresses problems such as delivery and schedule.
  • Act as liaison with subcontractors in expediting drawings and related information.
  • Monitor fieldwork, including contract work, to ensure compliance with company standards, procedures, specifications, and codes.
  • Coordinate periodic job-related photographs for records – as required
  • Assist with the research and preparation of field change requests to resolve design issues. Conduct quality control activities in accordance with instructions, inspection programs, using specified control measuring and testing equipment.
  • Prepare drawings and sketches to support construction work - as required.
  • Coordinate submittals and procure all close-out documents including warranties
  • Participate in the continuous updating and accurate generation of as-built documents – as required
  • Ensure all advertisement requirements as directed in the Daily Commercial News upon achieving Substantial Completion of the project.
  • Perform additional assignments and responsibilities as assumed or requested by supervision.
  • Contribute to a positive working relationship with the Owner and Consultant

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering
  • 2+ years of Project Coordination Experience
  • Must be proficient in Microsoft Project
  • Must have excellent organizational, administrative, communication, and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong Technical writing and analytical skills
  • Strong Design Software skills
  • Basic understanding of Commercial Contracts
  • Experience in the creation of project start-up documentation
  • Credible knowledge of municipal, provincial design standards
  • Valid Ontario Drivers License
  • Must be willing to travel 90% throughout Ontario

Job Type: Full-time

title: Coordinator, Consultant Services
company: SPI Santé Sécurité / SPI Health and Safety
description:
WHO WE ARE

With over 50 years of success in Canada, we are defined by the passion of our team and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
We have what we call GRIP: Go-Getter, Renders Service, Innovative and Passionate for succeeding. SPI's mission is to be “the single most valuable partner for companies that value health and safety in their work environment”. Whether this be personal protective equipment, Health and Safety training or consulting services, SPI has it all covered!

OUR OFFER

Work for an organization with a meaningful mission, great company culture with excellent work ethic in an extremely competitive industry.
Flexible group insurance plan,
Group RRSP
10 days of statutory holiday
6 paid personal days including a day off on your birthday
Employee assistance program
Opportunity to grow within the company

A stimulating work environment filled with challenge And the possibility to work in an environment where YOU matter!

YOUR CHALLENGES
  • The coordinator is accountable for maintaining a high level of quality service through the provision of administrative, production and support functions to the Burnaby consulting service team.
  • You will have frequent contact with varying levels of both internal and external resources. Internally, you will have daily contact with different levels of technical, support and specialist staff. Externally, you will have contact with customers ranging from Managers and Directors to Chief Executive Officers of multi-national operations.
  • You will be a key team member in representing and reflects the SPI 360-degree solution.
YOUR RESPONSIBILITES
  • Provide high quality administrative support by assisting in the preparation of customer reports and proposals; preparation of pipeline and sales reports; setting priorities; organizing and monitoring the workflow; and utilizing all available resources;
  • Compose, draft, and edit correspondence, and schedule consultants’ time within generally defined guidelines;
  • Assist with business research as required;
  • Coordinate customer work with various internal departments. Liaise directly with customers to obtain specific information as required;
  • Act as a communication link between consultants and customers by providing necessary information, responding to customers’ inquiries;
  • Maintain overall department efficiency through the consistent use of SPI record keeping systems;
  • Provide general support functions including proofreading, travel arrangements, meeting preparations, arranging catering, etc., as required;
  • Provide backup support for other Unit Coordinators and Project Coordinators;
  • Provide administrative and coordination support for internal practice initiative and programs.
This position has no direct reports.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
  • A Bachelor’s degree in public policy, economics, business, international relations, or other relevant degree;
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, and efficient in planning and executing concurrent diverse tasks and projects;
  • Collaborative and a team player;
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a similar role.
WORKING CONDITIONS
  • Fast paced environment with multiple projects and deadlines;
  • Development & growth possibilities.
Every day, our values guide our conduct to live in a respectful, honest, transparent and fair workplace. Choose to make a difference!

You want to work for a growing organization with a meaningful mission and excellent work ethic? We want to know you! Apply now!

SPI Health and Safety is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to treating all people in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To be eligible for this position, you must legally be permitted to work in Canada, without any additional sponsorship support from SPI Heath and Safety.

title: Corporate Travel Consultant (6 months contract)
description:
Corporate Travel Consultant

Kaltire is looking for a Corporate Travel Consultant. This is a 6-month contract role supporting the team while a team member is away.
The Travel Consultant will provide travel reservation services for all of Kal Tire’s Team Members. These travel services include Airlines, Hotels, Rental Vehicles, Meeting Facilities, and conference facilities. Arrange audio visual requests, projectors, and sound system.

This person will ensure that these activities are accomplished in accordance with the policies and procedures defined in the Kal Tire Travel Policy Manual.

Responsibilities

  • Booking commercial flights, car rentals and hotels on the GDS system and online platforms.
  • Issuing of airline tickets meeting BSP and IATA regulations
  • Booking of hotel rooms, meeting rooms, car rentals, Kal Tire vehicles, catering and shuttle transportation
  • Provide a high level of customized service to a variety of clients

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Recent advanced Apollo/Travelport or equivalent GDS experience in a corporate travel environment with minimum 2 years’ experience
  • Thorough knowledge of international travel reservations and ticketing requirements
  • Thorough knowledge of ticket exchange procedures
  • A commitment to deliver exceptional customer service to a variety of high expectation team members
  • Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills – both verbal and written
  • The ability to work as a team as well as independently and be self-motivated
  • The ability to manage conflicting priorities to ensure team members satisfaction levels are achieved
  • Experience in all administrative areas with demonstrated computer skills in MS Office Programs
  • Exceptional organizational and time management skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Good understanding of worldwide geography and IATA City Airport Codes

Education

  • Travel training program, Certified Travel Manager/Consultant (CTM or CTC designation), or equivalent experience.

About Kal Tire
Kal Tire is the largest independently owned tire dealer in Canada with over 250 locations. Our business philosophy centers on exceeding our customers’ expectations and relies on our entrepreneurial team members to provide exceptional customer service.

title: Regional Associate
description:
As one of the world’s leading asset managers, we are solely dedicated to delivering an investment experience that helps people get more out of life. If you're looking for challenging work, smart colleagues, and a global employer with a social conscience, explore your potential at Invesco.

Your role:

The Regional Associate provides support to a team of Wholesalers and Regional Consultants. Retail Sales is structured into regional teams across Canada, comprised of a face-to-face sales force, an inside sales team and sales support staff. Effective communication and the ongoing development of a collaborative culture within Sales and across the Invesco organization are key components in building valuable relationships across the financial community and achieving sales excellence.

You will be responsible for:

  • Advisor Meetings/Events:
    • Arrange advisor meetings as defined in the Territory Sales Plan
    • Assist the Territory team in coordinating branch meetings/small events. This includes, catering, on-site execution, driving attendance to branch meetings, and determine inclusion of kit materials based on discussion with Wholesaler.
  • General Sales and Marketing Support:
    • Coordinate and monitor prompt distribution of marketing materials
    • Facilitate Territory Team’s access to advisors and branches
    • Facilitate Territory Team’s access to advisors and branches
    • Championing service issues for Territory Team’s advisors with Client Services
    • Preparing Wholesalers for one-on-one meetings and branch presentations
    • Manage advisor recognition program for the territory
    • Organize and execute e-marketing campaigns on behalf of Region & Territory
    • Compliance Sales Practices & Co-operative Marketing Support:
    • Provide interpretation, guidance, education and clarification of rules, regulations, and Invesco policies to Territory team and external advisors
    • Works with and provides forms and information to Investments Advisors/Investment Advisor Assistants regarding the process at Invesco and compliance requirements
    • Traffics Advisor Initiated sales communications (advertisements) through the marketing & compliance approval process
    • Acts as the key contact with Investment Advisor (IA) /Investment Advisor Assistant and marketing & compliance
    • Keep IA and Wholesaler up-to-date on status of co-op requests
  • Administrative Duties:
    • Booking travel arrangements for Wholesalers/Inside Wholesalers
    • Prepare and submit expense reports for Wholesalers
    • Processing invoices, preparing cheque requisitions, and submitting invoices to accounts payable
    • Complete general office administrative duties for each Territory Team
    • Generate sales reports to be used in the business planning process
    • Provide ideas for advisor recognition
    • Provide ideas for business promotional events
    • Assist in monitoring of progress against the Territory Sales Plan
    • Maintain up to date contact information on SFDC

The experience you bring:

  • Post secondary education (business, commerce, administration) a definite asset, or equivalent work experience
  • Completion of CSC or ability to complete within an agreed upon date
  • Working knowledge of the mutual fund industry
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite
  • Teamwork and Collaboration
  • Effective oral and written communication skills
  • Proactive and takes initiative to improve operational effectiveness
  • Must possess excellent organization, problem-solving, issue resolution, attention to detail and customer service skills
  • Ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines

What’s in it for you?

Our people are at the very core of our success and we strive to provide employees with a competitive total rewards package which includes:

  • RRSP Contributions
  • Health & Wellness Benefits
  • Work flexibility Programs
  • Parental Leave Benefits
  • Study Support

The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The job holder may be required to perform other duties as deemed appropriate by their manager from time to time.

Invesco is committed to fair and accessible employment practices. If selected for an interview, we will work with you to ensure that your interview is accessible and accommodation is provided. Please contact us at accessibility@invesco.ca or 1.800.874.6275 to let us know if you require accommodation for an interview due to a disability.
